text: I love this place! They always deliver to my house! Iv basically tried everything on their menu and it's all so good! You can't go wrong. I recommend this place a lot. 100%

When I was a young boy my mom used to take us to this Thai restaurant off of Orange Ave in the city of Long Beach called little Ocha. Short story short, they closed the restaurant and never again did we find that same taste in another Thai food dish. All that changed today when I order from Thai food to go. It brought back so many memories and I was transported back to that round table we used to sit and enjoy that delicious chicken fried rice every week. This is authentic Thai food with a very warming family traditional taste to it. Will be eating here many more times from here on out. Loved it!!!
Super yummy!!! The LH potstickers and garlic white pepper pork was amazing! Definitely coming back. Got food quickly too, also very friendly :)

Absolutely incredible. Definitely a hidden gem of the east side of town. Food is deliciously fresh and well prepared and the service is excellent. The prices are also very low for the quality/service.
Thai Food To Go is one of the few cheap n authentic good Thai restaurants in LV. While most other places has been steadily increase prices. Their prices has been remain the same.
This place is amazing great food. My kind of spot hole in the wall family owned. Recommend the panang curry and green curry. Try out the calamari it's real and not of a bag
Great little place! We had chicken panang, pad Thai, BBQ chicken fried rice and it was delicious! I'm a little disappointed they don't have a bathroom.
Absolutely amazing. Great prices, consistently delicious food that is ready in 15 minutes. Deliveries are quick.

Don't let the size or location of this little 14-seat eatery fool you. The food is terrific and a single visit will likely make a regular of anyone who likes Thai. At least this is how it worked for my wife and me. 

We had the Drunken fried rice, Pad Thai and Golden Nest Noodle (Mee Krob) along with Thai tea. The dishes were excellent in every respect. The food was fresh, the quantities large, and everything was served promptly, courteously, and piping hot. 

My only complaint, and this probably has more to do with my age than any failing on the restaurant's part, has to do with the waiter's mode of dress. This young man really needs to pull up his pants! :-)

The service was fast, friendly and helpful. I ordered the pad Thai and requested no fish sauce which they were kind enough to accommodate me.  I was impressed with the flavor and how every bite to the end had the peanuts and bean sprouts.  The presentation wasn't the best only because everything looked the same color but that's just a personal preference to me. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for Thai food.
Taste really good "Authentic Thai" Love it! Ordered the Papaya very delicious and also you can customize how spicy you wanted (level 1-10)

Yo this shit was off the hook. I had this duck curry stuff that tasted like it was prepared by celestial thai virgins. And damn son did they keep my iced tea glass full the whole time. Only thing though is I thought a spicy 7 would be more spicy then it was. I'll prolly hit it up again.
Good food . Tom kah soup was great. Will definitely come back . They deliver on time. Best food delivered at my door step

Ordered food from here again for 20 people. Champ helped me with all the arrangements. The food was great and they delivered it on time to our hotel in MGM Signature. These guys are very easy to work with and Champ makes things a lot easier. I recommend that if you have a group event that you need to arrange for, work with Champ directly and he will take care of you. Great experience and delicious Thai food.

The staff was incredibly friendly and smiling and helpful and seemed like genuinely nice people.

They took extra efforts to decipher and look up a food item i was curious about that i couldn't remember the name in Thai language. Then they took it a step further and translated it for me into English.  Pok bong (sp?) is apparently morning glory. Maybe the stems are safe to eat (though I've heard stories about the flowers).

The food was prepared incredibly fast. awesome.

I'm eating some tom yum soup right now and it is nice. honestly it has a hint more salt then i would like but almost every soup at every restaurant i have ever eaten at except one place tastes a little salty to me. so perhaps I'm just sensitive to this flavor. The lemongrass tangy goodness is divine and the vegetable stir fry is quite fresh and crunchy and veggies are cooked to a nice bright green. I'm liking the papaya salad too. 

I ordered a 5 spiciness on a scale of 1-10 thinking that Thai standard would be a bit hotter, so I'd better hold back a bit. but I'm not finding it very spicy. so i think this spiciness scale is well fixed for an American pallet. I have a lot of flavor in my food  and just the slightest hint of spice. no after burn to speak of.

the restaurant dining area is small and uncomplicated. There is a pretty mural of boat people on the wall and some Thailand t-shirts. There are only a few tables available. The ambiance to me it is more of a convenience eating space for patrons because there is a sign that says no bathrooms.. so that means it is strictly a take out place for me.. i prefer to be able to wash my hands before/after eating. The second half of the restaurant's name is "to go" however, so i was actually surprised to find a dining area at all.

My sinuses are sufficiently cleared and I'm sniffling from joy over here. As it should be after you've eaten amazingly delicious and spicy panang curry. Wow! It was just spicy enough but not overwhelming. After reading reviews, I asked for level 4 in heat. I think they probably did a 5 but I'm not regretting it. I also went with the highly recommended pineapple fried rice. All I can say is these Yelp reviewers were right on spot. It was so delicious! I couldn't decide which I should eat at any given spoonful, the fried rice or the panang. Order from here, you will not be disappointed. This place has some very good Thai food! Do I really have to leave Vegas in two weeks?! http://www.rvlostyet.com
Was in Las Vegas for the 4th of July and decided to get some lunch here and I'm glad i did. Staff was very friendly and food was very yummy.

Came here for lunch and ordered the Pad se ew and Thai basil. Both of the two dishes were great. For the price of 5.50 for lunch and the nice portion. U get soup,egg roll or pot sticker and rice. The Pad Se Ew noodles was great because it wasn't clumpy. The seasonings on both of the dishes was on point. If you are looking for the Authentic Thai place this is the place to dine. 
Food: A (comfort food like moms home cooked meal) 
Service: A
My favorite place to go!!!

Always order delivery here. Food is always fresh, flavorful and hot! We haven't had a dish that didn't make our expectations! Husband loves their orange chicken. I always like to try different items when we order. All has been great! Delivery time is never long, we always get our food fast in a timely manner. Friendly staff as well!!

really delicious thai food, and at a reasonable price too. The owner champ was very friendly and opened the restaurant for me to dine in after hours as well, which I really appreciated. Pretty authentic and recommended for a quick bite if you find yourself in this part of vegas.

The food is excellent! I'm from San Diego and I would definitely go back to this little Thai food place next time I visit. 
I've never liked Thai ice tea until I had it here. 
Ever gone to a place where the portions were too small and not worth your money? Well, this place will not fail you. I highly recommend.

I come from San Francisco. Know this place from yelp.  This is like the hole in the wall.  But this is like a diamond in sin city. When the Las Vegas weather is killing me. 114 F. OMG.  Once I step in side I can feel the cool like heaven  from in side. I expect the air condition will work so hard.  But at least it better than Ac in  my rental car. Lol. Thai iced tea is cool me down they know how to make it. Even its just a iced tea. But trust me. You can tell the different from other Thai restaurant.   Deep fried chicken over fried rice. Perfect crispy chicken.  The fried rice it season perfectly not too oily not too salty. Beef noodle soup   It's very tasty.and don't forget there pot sticker.  So amazing.  I highly recommend this place.  They serve quality Thai food.  I don't really care about location or presentation like other many Thai fusion style.  But this is what I looking for the quality tasty and reasonable price.  I wish I could have this restaurant in my hometown San Francisco.  Thank you yelp to bring me here.

Pad Thai tasted like ketchup. Didn't like it at all. It didn't have the pad Thai taste I've had in other places. Thai tea was decent but LOADED with ice. Don't think I'll try any dishes here. Sticking to Thai cuisine that place is awesome.
I had the Spicy combination rice and was more than satisfied. The employees are extremely friendly, the portion of food was great for the price, and the lemonade was good as well.

My wife had PadThai. She thought it was better than most any she's ever had. It was on the $5.50 lunch special. It came with a small garden salad, and a Potsticker. 

I had the  saut√©ed eggplant, 7/10 on the hot scale. It was a dinner Item.  It was very good and I will have it again. The waiter provided a potsticker with my meal as well since it did not come with one. Maybe I will was just hungry. But at the time I thought it was one of the best potstickers I've ever had. It was a especially nicely decorated with stripes of sauce.

We chose this place because it has a good rating and was not very far away from where we were staying. But now I would suggest it's worth driving miles and miles for!

I ordered the golden crispy noodles with pork for 7.95. It was really good. Really cheap for the amount you get! The food lives up to the reputation! Owner was also very nice. Definitely worth going to. Wish there was something like this where I'm from.

It was my first time here and I have to say overall,  I was very satisfied. The food was tasty as I would like it to be and reasonably price. They have a steady flow of dine in and pick ups which goes to say their business is in good standing for repeats and loyal customers. Happy to say I'm excited to have found me a good Thai food restaurant when I'm in town.
Ive never been inside but i Postmates this place faithfully and its always good, only time i was a little disappointed was when they forgot my chili sauce :( but overall very good!

From the reviews I thought this was going to be a great experience.  I was at work looking at yelp for food  ideas and this place looked good.  Normally I go to Archi's or I go to Satay but this is closer to me.  So I place my order for panang curry w/beef in the lunch special and get an egg roll and wow it was only $6.55.  I get there and the place looks somewhat raggedy but the woman at the front desk was super friendly.  I get my food, awkwardly she doesn't give me change but I make my way back to the office.  Here's where the issues begin.

The serving size of the curry was so small.  Like not just lunch special small but like "am I really supposed to get full from this small".  I ordered a spice level 5 (on a scale from 1-10) and it was like an 8.  I can handle spice and I like spice but that was excessive since I wasn't expecting it.  The beef was akin to beef jerky and was boiled with 0 flavor.  At Satay they have shredded beef integrated into the panang to give it a different texture and and great flavor.  This tasted like nothing.  The curry was ok in flavor but very soupy.  The egg roll was random in flavor with no appetizing dipping sauce.  The fake sweet chili sauce had vinegar (weird).   Overall I had a flavor profile in my head that this didn't meet and I was still hungry. Blah
Ordered a take out of beef phadseew and chicken fried rice. Food was alright. Nothing out of the ordinary. Service was good.

Omg .... So good 

Was working at the convention center and looking for something to eat because I was starving. I was referred here and to my surprise the food was delicious. I ordered and it was yummy 

Curry chicken 
 Sweet n sour chicken 
Crab Rangoon 
Fried rice
Ordered a Beef Salad for delivery. It was wilted to shit and inedible. It also took an hour and 1/2 to get delivered. Avoid this place.

This place is a perfect example of you get what you pay for. Cheap, bland and low quality ingredients. Save yourself the time and money and go somewhere else. 
Give it a few tries because I know every place has its off days but always the same blahhh food.

I ordered from this place through Postmates and I am very disappointed and angry. I ordered the tom yum noodle soup, assuming it would just be the tom yum soup (a mostly veggie soup with just shrimp) with noodles, since neither their menu nor the Postmates menu explain what is in the soup, and I have no reason to believe that tom yum noodle would be different than tom yum, except for the addition of noodles. The soup I got has chicken and pork, which I don't eat. I called the restaurant to ask what was in the soup, and ask why this soup was so different from regular tom yum when the menu didn't mention any differences. Both men I spoke to on the phone spoke over me the entire time I was trying to get answers, until I just got frustrated and let them go because they would not listen to what I had to say.
I also ordered fried shrimp, and when I got them, I found that they were not fully de-veined, which is not okay! I ended up having to get rid of basically the entire meal, which meant wasting around $20. The food also smelled AWFUL, not normal for thai food at all. Do NOT order from here, do not give them business.

The food is so authentic..especially the yellow curry. Padthai was delicious, similar to what I had in Thailand. Garlic and pepper chicken was fragrant and crispy. EXCELLENT for quality and value of money.definitely a must eat when I'm in Vegas. 

I was planning to come back again tomorrow...but it's only opened at 11 am where I would already need to drive back to Los Angeles. Otherwise I wanted to try the penang curry salmon and tilapia fish with mango salad.
Good stuff, cheap and big portions. Potstickers are awesome! Have tried curry rice, bbq chicken and red curry so far- all good.
Not near our normal Thai place but very pleased to have found another good Thai food place very good food and good prices and friendly definetly coming again

Found this place on a whim.  Definitely a hole in the wall.  Decided to give it a try.  We had the spring rolls, chicken pad see ew, and chicken fried rice.  Everything was beyond delicious!  Everyone was nice as well.  I'd definitely recommend everyone try their Thai food.  You won't be disappointed!!

Went today for lunch. We had the lunch special. I had yellow curry with fried tofu. It was great. I also had the papaya salad. Both were fantastic. Five stars!!!!!  Also Champ the waiter was very attentive and knowledgeable
Visiting Vegas and used YELP. Clean, good food. Had lunch and very pleased with price and food. Would recommend. You will not be disappointed.

We ordered for delivery but the wait time was too long so I opted to pick it up. However, the food is so good! I've been craving Thai food for the longest time and wasn't sure where to go on the East side of Vegas but this place is worth it!

By far the best Thai restaurant I have tried.

The pricing is about average compared to other Thai restaurants, but the quality and quantity of food is much greater.

I ordered for a delivery to a specific office at UNLV (which is difficult to find sometimes), the delivery was timely and efficient.

Most Thai places have a lot of curry sauce and very little vegetables and rice. Thai Food To Go has a good ratio, so I don't end up eating "curry soup." It's actually a lot more vegetables than other Thai restaurants.

I'm a vegan, and was super duper happy that they had vegan options for curry and spring rolls. :D
Was craving papaya salad and chicken pad thai - delicious, friendly staff and worth the price. My new go to on the East side of town.

By far the best Thai places in town!! Came across this place couple months ago and I cant stop coming here. Other Thai food places don't even compare in the quality and flavor along with an amazing friendly staff!

I ordered drunken noodles with tofu and was given drunken noodles with loads of chicken. Appalling and inconsiderate to a customers dietary needs, I won't be returning. I will seek another establishment in which prepares a meal correctly. I highly urge any vegetarian or vegan to avoid this place.

Chicken pad see eww, and fried wings. Not sure how this place has as many stars as it does.  The food is below average... I had to pour alot of soy sauce and vinegar just to make the food tolerable.


I take that back I couldn't even tolerate the food. I only ate a small portion paid the ticket and left.  Terrible food, but the people were nice.
This place provided us an authentic  Thai food. I really enjoy every dish that I ordered. The price is very reasonable. I would recommend this place for people who like to try authentic Thai food.

I love this place! It is worth the drive for some good food. I ordered the green curry and it was awesome but I wish I had ordered the pumpkin curry special as a lady next to me did and she said it was to die for.

We ordered for delivery to our hotel on the strip. While they were friendly and nice, the food left little to be desired. We were hopeful for authentic, delicious Thai food given the staff really spoke Thai! However, after a lengthy, hangry wait, we were only left with disappointment and some people still hangry.

The noodle soups were so oily. The fried noodles and even the white rice lacked flavor and that oomph you get with authentic Thai food. AND we ordered the green beans with tofu and multiple people tried it, and it tastes like soap or dish detergent!!! That's just unacceptable. We'll stick to pizza delivery for hangover food next time.

We've been here 3 times already and we really love the place. The food prices are really affordable. They have good cutomer service. The place is really small but the food were really good. Although, there is not much variety of food to choose from. You can also get free thai tea(no boba) if you dine in and check in at Yelp. Overall, affordable food with good customer service.

The garlic chicken is amazing, I had it for lunch and ended up coming back for more for dinner! I really liked the Thai style beef jerky appetizer too. The potstickers were obviously frozen and not great. Worst thing is I got the Thai tea and it had small white chunks, the half and half was spoiled. They took it off the bill though, the food was good enough to excuse the drink.

Great restaurant with a nicely decorated small dining area. I kept reading about the great lunch specials and the free Thai iced tea with check in. So I made my way there today and was greeted by a very nice gentleman who quickly serviced my table and obliged me with me free Thai tea with check in. They started me with a yummy little soup and I ordered the green curry chicken lunch special for $5.50; it came with a chicken potsticker that had a yummy sauce. I ordered my curry a 6 and took half of my nicely portioned lunch to go. It was so spicy my ears starting tingling and my lips were lightly singing. Lol. Definitely a delicious spot to visit and re-visit. Love it!!!

It's my first time ordering here and maaaaaan lemme tell you, the lunch specials are pretty damn amazing! I ordered yellow pork curry, comes with vegetable spring roll, and some little salad on the side for only $ 5.50. It tastes really good! And the best one of all is the mango sticky rice priced at $ 4.50 each. It's good for two people but I consumed it anyways. :D

I didn't find this place extraordinary. The green curry was good, but it was pretty much the same as green curry that I can get at other Thai places around here. The beef was dry and that's always the problem with these stew types of foods at these places. The meat simmers in that broth too long and gets dried out. Then, I tried the crispy pork and broccoli because it sounded interesting. I didn't care for the pork although I liked the greens and flavoring in it. The pork was not crispy. The word should be "chewy," like beef jerky chewy. I won't be getting that again. I still will give them another shot because other things on the menu sounded good.

HORRIBLE.

I wanted to have delivery sent to my hotel because I didn't have a car. I placed an order and they'd call me back asking for the CC number. I was like ok.... 10 minutes later I get a call saying they can't deliver cause they don't have enough drivers to deliver. Are you freaking kidding me? If you're starving and want a reliable delivery. Avoid this place at all cost.

This became one of my go-to places to eat in the area. The food is cheap and tasty. I'm not a Thai connoisseur, but I feel I've had a wide variety of Thai food before- from good to very mediocre. This place is good. It's a little hole in the wall that serves tasty and authentic (to a Taiwanese guy...) Thai food. 

I liked the duck curry a lot, and their pad see ew is quite good too. And despite the name, you can eat at the restaurant, which is nice.
Over priced bad flavor and the pad Thai noodles completely over cooked and disgusting ramen noodles

I gave this place two chances. Once for dinner and now for lunch. Got pad Thai last time and panang curry this time.  Both times service was reasonable but food was mediocre to bad. The chicken in the panang curry was overcooked and tastes like it was mass boiled earlier and dropped in the curry before serving. No flavor. Green beans in the curry were raw, not al dente but raw. Fried rice had the distinct taste and odor of old shrimp. Also there is a hair on my plate. The only reason I give even one star is it is the cheapest lunch special around at $5.95 ...that said you are better off paying another $2-3 somewhere else to get dramatically higher quality food...such as a certain place on Fremont or on Sahara.
The flavor is out of this world! Some of the best thai food in Vegas, hands down. Spicy mint is my fave and the crab rangoons are a perfect appetizer.

Was looking for some fried rice on yelp and came across this place. Saw they had pad Thai and I wanted to try it plus it wasn't too far from my house. They have a website where you can order for delivery or to go.  The pad Thai was decent it could use some more spice. This review is based on my opinion of the pad Thai alone. I'll probably go back to try something else.

3.5.Delivery was pretty fast. Chef's special crab noodle was a bit salty, and tasted like phad Thai noodles.  Pad see ew w. Prawns was also salty.  Both dishes could have been better with more vegetables than the green onions.  The prawns were not fresh.  Yummy Thai ice tea.  The papaya salad arrived drowning in it's vinegar estate. Portions are very large.

My wife wanted to try Spicy Catfish, so I ordered it with my Kang Pow Chicken and Crab Rangoon. When I got there the women behind the counter said it would be a few minutes they are cooking the fish now.
one minute later she appeared with my order neatly packaged. The I arrived at home there was no Spice Catfish but some Delicious beef entree with Green Beans, Peppers, Onion and Green Paper Corns still on the stems. I was Wonderful. This was my second visit after a first gourmet meal a month ago. I would have left a 5 star only because my wife still doesn't know how the Spicy Catfish tastes.

There is something bittersweet about eating at a really good restaurant in a city that you don't live in. On the one hand, it's always nice to have a great meal. On the other hand, knowing you won't be able to eat it again for a long time sucks. However, in the case of Thai Food To Go, it more than sucks. It *fucking* sucks.

I'm going to try and make it through this review without crying, even though I have no idea when I will be in Vegas again, and way more importantly, get to eat Thai Food To Go agai-- dammit, I said I wouldn't cry!

Ok. Just a few more paragraphs to go. I can do this. Nevermind the fact that every time I eat any other Thai food restaurant I hurl the plates of inferior, Americanized Thai food against the wall in a fit of inferior-Americanized-Thai-Food-Induced-Rage. And that I dream of the Kana Moo Grob every night. And that I can never eat sticky rice with mango or drink Thai tea without thinking, "Thai Food to Go's was so much better". It's like hooking up with someone way out of your league but only one time. It was great and everything, but for the rest of your life you will always compare every other person's bod-- 

Fuck it. The tears are making the keyboard too slippery to type. Suffice to say this place is amazing and has forever ruined Thai food for me. Goddammit.
The yellow chicken curry over rice was really good! Fried rice OK, chow mein boring flavor. I would definitely order here again
Sorry, this isn't my favorite Thai. Experienced overdone chicken sweet & sour (mushy). I might give it another chance.
Wow it's Real Thai food in Vegas  spicy and heavy side !!!!!!  Delicious and fulfill I must be back

Order was adjusted and accurately handled.  Food was yummy quick and freshly prepared.  I loved the extra spicy fried rice and the Thai tea.  They sure know how to balance flavors perfectly.  Veggie egg rolls were crispy and hot.

One of the best Thai place in Las Vegas. Been there last time in 2012 when they just open.  This time still
fabulous.  Order food via their website have them delivered to my place.  Love Pad Thai w/ large size of shrimp for just $9.95.  If I have the same dish in my hometown SF, it should be over $18.  Green curry also tasty.  Highly recommended this place.
Very friendly place. I love that it's small and cozy. Pumpkin curry and roti are my favorites! Don't expect anything fancy but do expect true authentic Thai food.

Ok rarely i give 5 stars for places nowadays but this place had impressed me. Despite the location and size of place, the food is really good. It is probably my favorite thai restaurant in town now. 

Quick note: FREE iced thai tea with YELP check in and showing the waitress. Strong flavor without the overwhelming sweetness. A little "too" much half & half though. 

My friend and I had came here for lunch finally after hearing people raving about this place for a while. 

Prices are VERY good considering the quality you are getting. Lunch specials are $5.95. Typical items on the menu are mostly under $10. Even their specialty fish items are like $12. Wow ! 

My friend had ordered a Green Curry w/ Chicken Lunch Special with fried rice and potsticker and a house vegetable soup. Spicy level 7. - $5.95 - Good spice and flavor. A little strong on the coconut milk. Overall, great combination. The potsticker was nice and crispy. (note you only get one. i dont know about you, but i was kind of surprised LOL). Overall a decent portion size for a lunch special. I was surprised how much curry you get. Usually in other thai restaurants, you get in a smaller bowl (rice bowl size) 

I had ordered a normal Pad See Ew with chicken - $6.79? - good portion size. The dish was cooked very well. Lots of chinese broccoli flowers and stems. Noodles were cooked perfectly with a good amount of flavoring. Noodles weren't all in small ity-bity pieces. Shows the chef skill in cooking this type of noodle. Good "wok flavor" for those who know that term (familiar with a good quality item cooked in a wok). 

Overall, very happy with this experience. Would love to come back again for the same items (like spice level 10 !  ! )  if not try other things. ! 

Unfortunately, they ran out of mangos so we didnt get a mango sticky rice dessert to finish the meal off.

A coworker and I  were burned out from the strip. Checked yelp for a mom and pop food  place.  This was the first place that popped u.  Small thai food restaurant. Place was very clean upon entry.  Food came out very hot and fresh. Tom Yum soup was delicious! Had the pad thai chicken and was also very good. Food can be prepared extra spicy on scale from 7 to 10.  Free thai iced tea if you check in.  Server was so nice to refill my thai iced tea when I left.  about 6 miles from the strip.

Im so happy my husband found this place! At first I was skeptical, the way he described it made me question this place. One day I was craving thai food so he found a reason to bring me here. I ordered green curry with eggplant, hubby ordered drunken noodles and my 7 yrs old son had the orange/lemon chicken which all of em were really really good! Service was lovely and we found out they deliver too! Definitely will come back!
The food was yummy! Went one day the food was so good. I ended up going back the following day. Also, the prices are great! The crab fried rice is my favorite.

YUM.

best green curry I've ever had!

Thai iced tea free with check in!  

Service was great!

Authentic, tasty, and quick!  Girlfriend loved it too.  I will definitely be back when I'm in vegas again.

Fast delivery and delicious perfectly cooked chicken.. Highly recommend.. Would have been five stars but the peanut sauce tastes strange, but other than that it was great, and I am very picky with Asian food.
This place is adorable to take food all day and tgey have a great test of real Thai food that we should try. Awesome food and people service outthere..

Good food, their "spice scale" is crazy, though! I have been eating Thai food for over 35 years and have never encountered a place like this (a month later in Beaumont, CA ran into the same thing, though!).

My husband and I each had a lunch special. This comes with a soup of the day, which was Hot & Sour soup. Okay, I've had that hundreds of times at Chinese restaurants, never at a Thai restaurant. I would say it had a spice level of about 3-4, noticeable after it builds for a while, but tolerable.
I ordered my Red Curry "very Mild," but not "zero." It was spicier than the soup! I made it through eating it, but just barely. 
My husband ordered his dish (can't recall what he had), "medium."  I thought they must have gotten our orders mixed up in spiciness. Then I overheard a young man telling his friends that he had the night before ordered a dish spiced to "4." (maybe out of 5 instead of 10??) He said he could not eat it, it was so hot.

All this to say, be careful of how you order. Over all, I would say the food is slightly above average Thai restaurant food. The prices are great and they have a Yelp check-in deal to get a free Thai Iced Tea!  The service is friendly. The restaurant is tiny, tiny! 

I would probably try some other restaurants before going back, but I would not say to not try it. You might have a different dish that is terrific.

I just am trying to find Thai food as good as I used to eat 25 years ago in Vegas or 35 years ago in California !

This review is just for their delivery service and food, I haven't been inside the restaurant.

AWESOME. On a Saturday night at 8pm we were craving thai food but wanted to enjoy some ESPN 30for30 on the couch...delivery was the only option obviously. After first calling Satay Bistro (the usual go-to) and being told their delivery guy wasn't working, then calling Komol and also being told their delivery guy wasn't working (what restaurant decides not to have their delivery guy working on a Saturday night??) I poked around on Yelp and found Thai Food To Go. I figured I would give them a shot. We ordered:

-fresh spring rolls (the non-fried kind)
-thai beef salad
-chicken pad thai
-garlic chicken with brown rice

When the guy on the phone read my total bill I thought he must have left some of the food order off....he claimed my total was $25. Really?? Ooookay. We will see if the food arrives correctly...

The food arrived in about 35 minutes of ordering. Everything was hot, fresh, delicious AND they threw in a free order of the fried spring rolls and a free order of crab ragoon! On top of everything else we ordered I would say $25 (plus a good tip) was well worth it. That order from Satay or Komol would have costed at least $40 or more!

I definitely support the mom-and-pop operations and Thai Food To Go is a solid business with great food and (delivery) service.

I will definitely be checking out their establishment in person very soon.

I ordered Satay chicken, shrimp pad Thai and Larb. I only like the satay chicken, the pad Thai and larb aren't as tasty as what I'm used to. The Pad Thai also only have 7 shrimps with a huge serving of noodles and it's lacking on sauce and no lime and fresh bean sprouts. Overall the delivery was fast but I don't think I'll order here again.

I stopped in on my way home, hoping to get some red curry. I placed my order and asked for a zero spice level, as I'm not a fan of all that extra spice. I drove home and my food was still piping hot. But when I looked inside I could immediately see the red flecks that usually mean DANGER! Sure enough, I would say it was easily a spice level 5. My lips were burning and I could barely eat it. Also, who puts green beans in red curry? That all being said, it did have a good taste, what I could taste beyond the burning in my mouth! I bet it would be delicious if they had made it as I asked. However, since they didn't, I will not return.

Tried this place out because we were running an errand close by. Small place, only 5 or 6 tables. Simple menu. But it was so delicious! I ordered the 3 buddies which comes with papaya salad, BBQ chicken and sticky rice $10. Flavors were great! Husband got the garlic chicken, you can really taste the garlic. 
We will definitely be back!

Enjoyed lunch with friends and wanted to try this after all of the great reviews.  Plus, you get a free Thai Iced Tea with a Yelp check-in.

I tried the Chinese broccoli with crispy fried pork.  The broccoli was nicely done, but the pork was more like chewy beef jerky.  Decent flavor, but a bit difficult to eat.

I'd like to try them again and try the lunch specials - they look like a great deal at $5.50 a shot.
The food is really good. The staff is super friendly. They have multiple ways you can order (ubereats, yelp, grubhub....). Definitely would recommend.

*Disclaimer: this review is primarily for the yellow chicken curry

If you know me well enough, you would know that Thai yellow curry has got to be one of my favorite dishes of all time. The combination of sweet and spicy does me in. With that being said, I have this weird thing where I must try different Thai restaurants around town just for their yellow curry. I've tried around 7 different places now and Thai Food To Go has got my vote for the best yellow curry that I have had to date! The flavor is out of this world: there is sweetness in every bite. I'm not crazy about crunchy vegetables in my curry, either, but the veggies in this curry are so soft. It's almost like they slow cooked the curry in order to let the flavor penetrate every part of the dish. 

Anyway, getting away from curry, the place itself is pretty nice. There is a beautiful mural located inside the restaurant depicting some Thai people on a boat out on the water. The employees are very nice and whenever I order through Eat24, my food is always done earlier than anticipated. I've ordered delivery before at my old address as well, so I've been coming here for around 3 years. They will continue to have my business and you should give them yours, too.
One of the best places in Vegas. Love the Thai Beef Noodle Soup.L

DELICIOUS Thai food, and great prices. 

$5.50 for lunch specials, and no extra charge for brown rice. I got the spicy green beans with chicken lunch special with brown ice and we also had an order of vegetable soup. 

Plenty of vegetables to satisfy a veghead like myself and great service. The place IS very small though, we were lucky we were able to seat the 5 of us together because most of the tables are meant for two. 

If I lived around here, I'd definitely be here often.

There is only one word to describe this place: AMAZING!! My sister and I were looking for something to eat and we stopped here after reading some reviews. I have to say it did live to its expectations.

Probably the best Thai food I've had in Vegas! Tasty food, great prices, friendly people. The only thing I might improve is the dining room, as it's not the most comfortable place to eat. If I could, I'd rate this place 4.5 stars, and recommend takeout versus dining in.

This place is awesome. Authentic Thai I think, although I have tried many good Thai restaurants in the neon desert, and never get tired of trying new restaurants. Competition brings the best in everyone. This place has awesome dessert (sticky rice mango).

Cheap, fast, whole in the wall with quality food and service. Three times so far and have no complaints. Their "fresh ginger" is delicious with chicken. Their spicy chicken wings are really good as well. Tried their chicken satay, very good. Papaya salad was ok bit on the strong side. Calamari was different, big pieces, but very good. Crab fries rice also good but not all of the crab was shelled good enough so sometimes really hard shell pieces.. This place is all around good though, specially if you don't make a reservation at Lotus of Siam, don't want to want but still want yummy Thai food.

When they say "to go" they mean to go, they had our order out really fast. Not only is it affordable but the food tastes so good! I got potstickers and spicy chow mein with my boyfriend they said they can make my chow mein spicy if I want to and he asked me how spicy do I want it from a scale from 1-10 i said 8 and let me tell u that was spicy and so delicious and the potstickers..... I've never tasted these before and they came fried with a sauce and garnished beautifully it tasted so good I recommend 2 orders of potstickers cus they are so delicious. Also had pad see eu, don't be scared to try new things it was so delicious made my heart happy! This place is so affordable and the staff is friendly strongly recommend !

I absolutely love this place.  My friend took me for lunch, it's only 1 girl that works there as a server, they are all family.  Small, clean, the food is amazing and doesn't hurt my stomach.  Not greasy, smells good.  You sit and can look right into the kitchen as they prepare your food.  The floors and counter tops are amazing clean.  The service is great, and I love the food.  Not open on Sundays, learned that the hard way.  Take some friends and try it out.  The best Thai food in Las Vegas hands down.

I eat Thai food but this place brings flavor to another level with their sauces. They are located in a strip mall that does not seem to get very busy. The BBQ chicken, papaya salad, pad see ew and fried chicken were all good. The hot food came out really hot and freshly cooked. This is one of my favorite place. You got to try it out to understand what I mean.

Authentic delicious flavorful Thai dishes!! When ever I'm on the east side I always make time to stop by and grab some quick cheap and awesome Thai food.. So far everything that I've eaten there has been phenomenal... don't be intimidated by the small dinning area because great flavors can come from small places as long as you have the right ingredients...

This place is a small Thai food restaurant 10min away from the strip. 
Believe me! -well worth it.
The owner is very nice and makes sure his customers are happy and ATTENDED to ( ex. You don't have to wait minutes to refill your drink or to pay!)
The food which is the critical factor to me is GREAT. 
While everyone eats Pad-Thai, ask for a Pad-See-Ew. 
It's better and is MUCH tastier than the other Thai food joints around the strip in Vegas. 
Another 5star experience all around.

This wasn't first time there. I placed an order for pickup. As soon as I walked in the door, I was greeted by name which was pretty cool. The food was delicious. We ordered three dishes and they were all delicious. Happy to have discovered this place and will definitely go back again.

Wow! After reading some other reviews prior to ordering this place is for sure the fucking bomb dot com! Greatest Thai food ever! I'd give them 10 stars if I could! 

Crab Rangoon are real! None of that 99% cream cheese 1% crab shit!
Everything's is so good here, I highly recommend this place for everyone to try out, u won't be disappointed..

Great service. Friendly staff. Delicious authentic Thai cuisine at good price. This is my go to Thai restaurant ! Forget about those fancy smancy Thai restaurant that'll charge ya up the butthole for small portions. This place hooks it up with more for less price. Bang for you're buck my fellow foodies

Awesome Thai food place! We sat in the restaurant and ate, it was quick and quite delicious! The pad thai is a very generous portion, level 5 spice was pretty intense. The Thai jerky beef was delicious! I would recommend to stop in and try. It's priced efficiently as well!

For a place called Thai Food "to go", it is not very "to go" friendly.
Went here last night, and my husband recommended calling ahead of time to order food. I declined that, because I didn't want the food sitting in a box, ... I hate that idea.

The place was empty, and I had no problem getting ahold of a young lady to take my order. It was also done in a decent amount of time. I paid and was on my way. In the matter of the 15 minute drive home, the deep fried catfish was no longer crispy. The container of my duck soup was overflowing when trying to transfer it to a bowl so I could eat it (noodles were packed separate, and the broth was filled to the top and couldn't handle anything being added to it.)

The crab fried rice had no flavor. I was trying to guess the difference between egg and crab....Not a good thing. Naga's crab fried rice has chunks of real crab in it, and is very flavorful....and can have spiciness added to it. 

When we do come back, it will be for "dine In'' only.
Food is always great and service is fast and friendly. The menu has good selections to choose from and the prices are good. Highly recommended;)

Horrible customer service...::.....:waited at the table for awhile I had to standup to ask for a menu still sitting there and no service...... No restroom for customers what and it's a restaurant...... We use to eat here awhile ago....... And everything was great......Would not recommend this place

I was craving Thai food in Vegas and did not want to go anywhere that was serving overpriced, fusion, Thai food on the strip.  So I found Thai Food To Go on Grubhub.  It was a great decision.  The pad thai was good and authentic with the pickled radishes.  The red curry was delicious (I could drink the curry).  The pad see ew was good with Chinese broccoli (the right kind) instead of American broccoli.  And the cashew nut chicken was delicious.  Make sure to also get the Thai iced tea (I got the big one).  It is huge and definitely enough to share.  I'd order from this place again next time I'm craving Thai in Vegas!  Also, the delivery and service was very quick and pleasant.

I was impressed with their takeout. Price is very good. My food was piping hot which was great.
I travel a lot for my job, so I do a lot of takeout. This place is definitely a winner. I will be back! Great portion size for me and my family.

We came here 2 people, ordered enough food for at least 4 people, and ate it all.  Everything was very good.  The service was super friendly and the prices we excellent.  We will be back for sure.  If you come, don't miss the delicate and flavorful broth of the veggie soup - filled with beautiful veggies!

This is definitely  take out quality...not that that's bad.
I order pad see-u w/chicken. It was good but there was only about 6 chicken pieces in order and  the rest noodles.
I just want what I pay for. Stingy is going to kill business.  
They stopped  their lunch special,  which was disappointing. Strike 2!!!
There's  a couple more items I will try to give them a chance to redeem themselves.
We shall see...

Stay tuned for updates....

Everything was delicious! We got Poh thak, wild boar, duck curry, & three buddies. And Thai tea! My Thai tea was really sweet and the duck curry I feel like it wasn't much duck and a lot of coconut milk. But other than that everything was so good. Big portion and very affordable price.

I had the food delivered to my hotel and the driver was on time and food was hot. The driver can text you when he is close so you know when to go down to meet him. 
Big portions and quality is so so. I ordered tofu pad Thai and chicken pad see ew and beef salad. The pad Thai noodles were very dry and hardly any sauce. Looked like it could have been microwaved and sent. The pad see ew was good- very flavorful. The salad had a little bit too much fish sauce for my taste. The price and convenience of food delivered are great for Vegas. I had to come for a my kids volleyball tournament and was so tired from walking so having someone else cook, delivered and not break the bank -awesome!!! All the other moms were jealous that I thought of food delivery and they just ate nuts and crackers :)

Go East, young man! To the East SIDE, that is. For Thai food.
Don't let the name fool you, it's a cozy location with dine in available. The high ratings are entirely justified, everything I've tried here has been great and the prices are extremely reasonable.

CHINESE BROCCOLI WITH CRISPY PORK: So good! Pork is perfectly cooked with a crunchy exterior and moist, juicy interior. Broccoli is tender, sauce is delicious. Would get this again.
CRAB FRIED RICE: This is a gigantic, flavorful portion! Every bite seems to have crab in it, and the mountain of food can easily be split by two or three people. One of the best CFR dishes I've had.
GRILLED SALMON PANANG CURRY: Salmon is on the dry side, curry itself is intense! Plated with green beans, carrots, and broccoli, which was an odd combination that surprisingly worked. 
MANGO STICKY RICE: Classic dessert, good-sized portion, rice is just right and mango was perfectly ripe.

They offer delivery to a 3 mile radius, with only a $15 minimum. Most dishes in the $8-10 range. My only regret is that this place isn't closer to me!

I was in LV for the night and did a yelp search for the best Thai in the area and this place popped up.  I ended up ordering several things off the menu to-go.  Overall it took a long time for the order to be ready.  The customer in front of me said she had been there for over an hour and her meal still wasn't ready.  So that was a negative.  Got back to our hotel and tried all the dishes.  Overall they were ok to pretty bad.  Not even close to the quality of Thai we have in Seattle.  I am not sure why this place has such a good rating...

With some effort this place could be great. You can watch what they cook in front of you and my girlfriend and I saw them put a bunch of white stuff in with our food. I asked what that was and they said "SUGAR'. 

Who ever heard of adding several tablespoons of sugar to a simple Thai food dish? YUK!

Also, don't expect the Open sign or posted hours to mean anything.

The old guy is a sweetheart and I do hope they improve soon. We will give them another try.

Was a decent place. Ordered a chicken dish with added veggies. No chicken arrived but was charged an extra $1.00 for the veggies...

The food was good, not great. The service was Good, not great. The speed was satisfactory, not great. The portions were exactly correct, dishes, silverware and chopsticks were nice.

I'm a little upset about ordering a chicken dish, adding extra veggies, then getting only a veggie dish (no chicken) and being charged for a chicken dish with an added charge for additional veggies. I hope that makes sense.

Food was good, and the delivery was great. My issue was when they charged me without letting me know first hand after I already placed my order. I wanted to make sure I got peanut sauce with my fresh spring rolls, (most Thai Restaurants give peanut sauce automatically with fresh spring rolls) so I put it on the extra notes under Spring Rolls. Instead I get an up charge for peanut sauce without calling or notifying me first hand. I get the order and it came with sweet and sour sauce (which is used for fried egg rolls).

This place is my go to spot of lunch or dinner on the go. I occasionally dine in here but definitely order take once or twice a week. 

The people here are extremely friendly and fast. I order 10 minutes prior to arriving to the restaurant and it's always ready. I would definitely recommend their duck panang curry and pad see ew. I have tried a lot more of their foods but tend to stick to these two comfort foods because they always satisfy my Thai cravings. Everything I have tried at this place does not disappoint; the papaya salad and green curry is also very tasty and especially their ginormous Thai tea! 

Overall, if you are looking for good Thai good without the wait and hassle of eating out I do love this place. Try it and you won't be dissatisfied or disappointed.

I've been getting Thai Food To Go, to go, for years now. I've never dined in as the inside is small and only has a few tables. Plus the name kind of suggests you should get it to go, and I am good at following directions. :) I've tried the shrimp pad Thai (squirt fresh lemon over the top of this), yellow curry chicken, panang curry, tom kha soup, chicken satay, cream cheese rangoons, pad see ew, and many more items over the years. Everything has always been excellent. Their peanut sauce is sooo good I always get some on the side and eat it with my pad thai or add it to the panang curry. Sometimes I just eat it plain with a spoon. It's goooood. 

FYI: they are heavy handed with the spice, although  you can pick your intensity 1-10. My last visit I tried the panang curry at a spice level 5 and it was a little too hot for me so take that how you want. While waiting for my food I asked for a large Thai tea and it came in a large styrofoam soup container! See pics. This made me LOL. I really dont have anything negative to say about this place. I will keep coming here when I am in the area.
Good ambiance and great good. Very very authentic Thai food. A must thai place to go when visiting Las Vegas

This place is a family owned restaurant. Everyone here has great customer service and welcomes you well through the front door. The food here is amazing, but yet affordable. The theme of their restaurant really does makes it feel like we're not in the US. Which makes this restaurant much more enthusiastic. I would highly recommend the Three Buddies for first timers.

I just ordered food here and I must say it was absolutely delicious . It was fresh and tasted great . Also the service was very quick.  I would definitely recommend eating here if in the Las Vegas area.

WOW. I was not expecting such a good joint (even with 4.5 stars on Yelp). What do you think when you hear "To Go" in a, Asian restaurant's name? Probably pre-made, oily, salty vats of food scooped up into paper boxes and Styrofoam container accompanied by underwhelming side selections. This is far from that.

Despite the somewhat dilapidated exterior and slightly cheesily decorated interior, there is a lot of character to this small family-run joint. As you walk in, to your left is a mural of a river market in Thailand. To your right on the far wall there are menu items listed with pictures of their specials. The tables and chairs are what you'd expect from a middle-of-the-road restaurant; the tables are sturdy and the chairs look to be fairly new. On the tables are the traditional condiments for Thai food (chili pastes, pickled jalepe√±o slices, and other spicy yums). The man who was our server, who I assume to be the owner, is a jolly, middle-aged Thai gentleman by the name of Yai(?). What he lacks in his ability to speak English well he certainly makes up for in character. He was very attentive  to my family's table and seemed to make his best effort to make sure we were content. Boy, were we beyond content!

ON TO THE FOOD! What we ordered and their ratings out of 5 stars:

Vegetable Egg Rolls: 3 of 5
- Pretty standard egg rolls. They were good, not great, but they were presented nicely with some sweet and sour sauce and were good enough to be gone by the end of dinner.

Pad Thai with Chicken: 5 of 5
- So, let me start out by saying that I usually don't like pad thai; it just isn't my thing. We got it because it's my parents' favorite. My parents loved it and I loved it. It had the standard vegetables and chopped peanuts, but the sauce and noodles were what made the dish work so well. The noodles were soft but not chewy, and they didn't stick together. The sauce was slightly spicy, because we asked for it that way, but not overwhelming nor bland.

Pad See Eu with Beef: 5 of 5
- Now this is my favorite dish to get at Thai food places. I loved the one they made for me here. The vegetables were slightly crisp, the noodles were nice and chewy, and the beef was tender. One of the biggest problems I have with other places' pad see ews is that there either too much or too little sauce; I didn't have this problem here.

Crispy Pork with Broccoli: 4 of 5
- This dish had a lot of flavor. If you like garlic without it overpowering the dish, this would be something for you.  As with the pad see eu, the broccoli was cooked to perfection. My only issue with this dish is that the pork was a little too chewy/dry for my liking (but maybe that's how it was supposed to be).

Sticky Rice with Mango Slices: 5 of 5
- Just the right amount of sweetness from the mango and coconut milk. The rice had a great texture and went well with the mango. A must try!

Overall, my family was very pleased with it's experience. This is my new favorite Thai food place. We are definitely going to visit again before we leave Vegas.
This is my favorite Thai place in town. Don't forget to check in for the free Thai tea.

Came here for lunch and was in and out within 5 minutes! The Thai iced tea was delightful. I order the yellow curry with beef. It was seasoned very well with a little kick. 

The only downside was that the curry sauce was super watery. I prefer my curry to be much more thick so that I'm not soaking the rice.

As I'm finishing my meal I noticed that they barely gave me any meat! For the size of the container they give you would think it wouldn't be all soup. Thumbs down for that!

Had to have us some Thai food that day... this place was well worth it! My wife, mom and myself visited family one weekend and decided to try this joint out. We dined in. So here's what we had: HK Potstickers, Padthai shrimp, Thai style papaya salad, Pineapple fried rice, Tiger cry beef jerky, Mango and sticky rice. Of course we took leftovers to go. The potstickers I believe is their signature appetizer and was very tasty. Some spice from sriracha on top gave it some kick. Padthai shrimp was awesome! Padthai is my favorite dry noodles to eat in Thailand and people can butcher it. Usually I see restaurants make PadThai too soupy. I can't stand that! It takes a bit of practice to make PadThai from the high heated wok by a flame burner(not electric). Seems like this place has it down. Pineapple fried rice had a good balance of pineapples and flavor but not over powering. My wife was craving that one :). Tiger cry beef jerky and sticky rice was phenomenal. Well seasoned and very tasty! All I needed was a beer to go along with it. It's finger food that I can live by everyday. Thai style papaya salad had a good portion and had the flavor that was use to when I was living in Thailand. I was told their flavors are consistent every time because the ingredients are identical in measurement every time except the amount of heat requested by the customer. As for the finale, the mango sticky rice finished our meal perfectly. Mango wasn't too ripe or brown and the sticky rice had the perfect sweetness from the coconut milk and sesame seeds. 

On top of our great experience there, we observed the amount of orders they were receiving from UberEats going in and out of the place. People apparently loves this place! Spoke to the owner and was told that the orders just keep coming. I'm pretty nosey so I asked the Uber driver and they get orders from here all the time. Locals and visitors. 

This small restaurant might look small but it has potential to grow bigger as people find out it exist and how good the food is. I will definitely visit Thaifood Togo again when I'm back in town.

Usually the food is pretty good .  today the beef and meatball soup was bitter not sweet and there was only one meatball.  the fried rice was pretty good.  this has been our place for rice and noodles but I'm afraid there has been another change in owners .

Came to vegas for a much needed vacation. Craving some Thai food and came here. I don't know where to begin everything was good. Excellent service! They were very attentive to what we needed..napkins, more water. Never had to ask for it. We ordered pad thai, yellow curry, mango sticky rice, and tom yum soup. Tom yum soup is yummy lol! If you like your food spicy they will ask you what level you would like it. We got the yellow curry at a Level 7 and the tom yum soup at level 5. Level 7 was really spicy for me and the level 5 was still spicy but still edible. I would definitely dine here again the next time I'm in town.
It was very tasty. I had a pineapple shrimp dish that was great. I want to go back and try more! It was well priced, and the gentleman who took my order and served me was very friendly

I was not a big fan of this restaurant the first time I tried it.  The pad see ew did not impress me.  My friends really enjoy it here so i tried it again.  This time i had the garlic prawns.  WOW! To die for!  Large fried shrimp, crunchy and flavorful.  I order something similar at another Thai restaurant not too far from here.  This is by far a better price and just as delicious in its own way.  I would definitely choose this place first if I've got the craving.

Wow. Just as good the second time! 
The Red Curry was a bit thinner than the first trip, but still delicious. Got a Green Curry to go and was pleasantly surprised that it hadn't 'solidified' in the fridge overnight like some Thai and Indian places' curries made with other fattening ingredients. 

Discovered the awesome tabletop Fish Sauce which can be included as a condiment in your to-go bag.

West-siders and Hendersonites, it's totally worth the extra distance to eat here if you're hungry for Thai. The value and taste are undeniable. 

Quick Tip: The parking lot *is* a little sketchy, so don't dilly-dally getting in/out of your car.

I found this place on the Yelp app about a year ago when I was craving for Thai. I searched "Thai Food To Go" and this place was the third place on the search results. You would think it would be the first one on the list considering this is literally the name of the place, but what do I know.

Anyways, I have probably been to TFTG at least twenty times since my very first visit. The yummy food, generous portions and the pricing is what keeps me going back. The restaurant itself is small with only about 4 tables for those rebels wishing to dine in at a place with the words TO GO in their name. I've had my food for here a couple of times and thankfully the service was friendly despite the name is not Thai Food FOR HERE. The drinks came quickly and the food arrived at the table steaming hot so you knew that it was fresh off the stove. 

Even though I tell myself that I need to be adventurous and order something different, here are the two things that I always end up ordering:

1. Pad see ew ($7)-- A common, yet delicious fried noodle dish. It has Chinese broccoli, flat noodles, egg, and your choice of meat. I usually get it with chicken! 

2. Deep fried chicken fried rice ($7)-- Did you catch that? It has fried in its name twice, it has to be good! Seriously, it is tasty. The fried chicken is crispy and the fried rice is perfect.

I have also had the chicken wings. The chicken wings were okay, but for the price I would rather have another entree that comes with rice or something. I also had the mango with sticky rice for dessert. They have a fried banana and ice cream dessert that I have been meaning to try.

Overall, TFTG is on my list of top favorite places to eat since my move to Vegas. Little family owned restaurants are the best when it comes to taste and authenticity. Come check this place out and get your pad thai on!

Ordered off grub hub last night and they actually deliver fast and the food is delicious!!! Ive been going to thai food to go for years so i knew their pad see ew wouldnt let me down and i was totally right, started off my meal with some crab ragoons!! HEAVENLY!!

This used to be one of my favorite places to go. Lately for the last 6 months or so they have been skipping the crab in the crab fried rice. They gave also been charging 1.75$ for peanut sauce. I after many years of ordering here will never again until they fix these issues. I even went back inside to show there was not a speck of crab and was told its white crab it blends with the eggs. Never again. You really lost a dedicated customer and more when i show the photos! Poor quality , no crab, bad service. I expressed my concern and was turned away via walk in and phone.
Great taste! Awesome Yelp Deals! They also threw in a Thai Tea because it was my first time ordering online!! We will be back soon!

Do not let the name fool you. This is not chop shop Thai food. I'm as picky as they come when it comes to Thai food, having lived in places with lots of Thai food and Thai restaurants, where the competition is high and so are the standards.

I've lived in Las Vegas since 2009. I've tried sooo many Thai restaurants. This is the first one that had all my favorite items, and they were all PERFECT! The thai tea was PERFECT, not too sweet, not too creamy, and the tea was nice and strong. The Tom Ka Kai at most restaurants is too sweet and creamy and not sour enough. Here is was, again, PERFECT. Most restaurants I've tried in Las Vegas don't even HAVE Drunken Noodles. They had them aaaand they were PERFECT. Lots of crisp green vegetables, the exact right amount of sweet vs salty vs spicy, the exact right amount of basil, perfectly cooked seafood, and the squid wasn't rubbery. 

The staff are super attentive and sweet. Honestly, this is good as ANY Thai food I've had in LA, Orange County or NYC. And probably better since ALL my favorite things were perfect and not just one or two items. And that is saying a lot. There are only a few tables, as most people get their food to go, but

Thanks Dan for telling me about this place. Despite how unassuming it is from the outside it's great! Very casual. The price is right. The service is great. Check in and score a thai iced tea. We've been a couple times and our favorite was the panang. Even though the sauce looked thin we got flavor punched. If I wasn't such a sissy I would have gotten it spicier. Oh man and you gotta try those pot stickers. They are smothered in sauce and it's actually good. Everything we ever gotten was so good. The portions are so generous--plenty leftovers! Protip- try not to get that table right by the door. Also, weird tidbit, they have a scientology book on display behind the counter.

My favorite Thai in the area. I like it more than Lotus of Siam. The drunken noodle is perfect and the Thom Kha is my substitute for Chicken noodle soup (helps fend off colds with the lemongrass!) 

It's very inexpensive and the staff are sweet.
Amazing Thai food. Free Thai iced tea with check in! Our server was very attentive and courteous. Will be back again.

Small Thai family Owned take out and restaurant. Using their own classic recipes truly delicious and very fairly reasonably priced and always quick, fast friendly service. You have to try the fresh spring rolls and house 1 ton soup!

This place has AWESOME food!! Don't let the name or cheap dinnerware fool you. It's a little mom and pop joint (but those are always best). A must try!!! The pineapple shrimp curry is to die for!! Cashew chicken is a must try as well as the crunchy garlic pork. Very humble people and always happy to hear their customers comments. Never had a bad meal or service!! No public restroom though or cocktails but theres a bar near by for you're night cap! We will absolutely be back!!!!!

1st time there and ordered basil chicken (hot), papaya salad lao style (hot) and thai beef jerky and was my mouth burning lol, great taste overall. I will be back for more. I give this place 2 thumbs up
In the Yelp pictures, shows there's a lunch special but there isn't.  Food does not taste that good.
Amazing food and fast delivery!!  Everything was perfect and very tasteful. I will definitely order again
The only Thai place I'll go to and they're nearly across town from where I live! The food always tastes amazing and service is fast and friendly. Highly recommend the Thai basil

We had the papaya salad which had way too much fish sauce and huge pieces of raw cabbage, had one bite and threw the rest away. The fresh spring rolls were pretty good and the pad Thai was ok. Nothing special. They do make a good Thai iced tea.

Was visiting a family member at desert springs hospital and wanted to go somewhere close and inexpensive. Came onto yelp to see what was around and this place popped up, needless to say it's an amazing hole in the wall place. Service is very friendly. Don't let the looks of inside scare you away. FOODS BOMB ! plus free thai tea when you check in on here:)

THIS RESTAURANT WAS THE BEST FOOD I ATE IN VEGAS.

We were staying on the Strip so it was a trek and we went here after an Asian spa experience on Sahara. It took about 40 minutes by bus to get there and some of the connections were late...thanks RTC. But once we got there, our order was taken and food in front of us happened in span of 5 minutes. 

We ordered vegetable egg rolls with the spicy sauce (5 for $5? $6) that were perfect for hungry, weary, public transited travelers. Man, they were good. Also, I used the check in offer for a free thai iced tea. It was delicious!

For my main, I ordered pad thai ($6.95 for chicken, beef, pork, add $2 for combo) and it was served about a minute after the egg rolls came out. I wasn't asked about it's spicyness but I'd say it was mild, like bbq sauce or a smokey heat. Really tasty! I always love peanuts on my pad thai so I'd love more but it was a good portion of everything. Egg, leek/scallion, peanuts, bean sprout. . .man it was delicious. I ordered another thai iced tea. My bf had drunken noodle at a 5 and it was somewhat spicy but basically everything was just awesome.

Five tables, just like everyone else said. Credit/debit accepted. Great service, on the bus line. No complaints. Go there.

Delicious Thai food! We came to visit from Phoenix, and after looking around for a place to get our Thai fix on, we came here. The reviews did not lie, this place is FANTASTIC! The curries have a great flavor and a great kick even at the mildest levels. The chicken satay was delicious, the peanut and sweet chilli sauce was delicious too! 

The owner was very sweet, he really seemed to care to see that we enjoyed the food. They were pleasant, friendly, filed with smiles, and a wonderful dessert recommendation (do not skip the mango and sticky rice!). 

Great food, friendly service, great prices!

It's been 8 years already that I didn't go back to Thailand. I miss everything there and this place just make me feel like home. Thank you you guys so so much you guys are the best!!! Everything just right. Can't wait to go back ;)

Let's get straight to the point, this little Thai restaurant is skyrocketing near the top of my list.  I was extremely impressed with this place.  While the atmosphere feels like a small hole in the wall, and the seating may be a little cramped, rest assured that this is some of the best authentic Bangkok style food in Vegas as of this review.  

On my first visit I tried the Pot Stickers ($5.95), Green Curry Fried Rice ($7.95), and Green Curry with Beef ($6.95).  The Pot Stickers were similar to the ones served at TSNH.  The fried shell had a light crispness to it, and it was topped with a creamy orange sauce (I think it's the same sauce you get on a lot of sushi rolls).  They were pretty good, although nothing to rave about.  At least, not compared to the next two dishes.

The Green Curry Fried Rice was absurdly good.  Spiced heavily with just enough heat (I ordered a 7/10), the balance in flavor was spot on while still having that strong herbal/spicy array of authentic flavor.  The vegetables, which included short slices of green beans, were firm and juicy (not as juicy as good ol' Pan Asian mind you).  The chunks of chicken breast were most impressively juicy and tender as well.  I highly recommend this dish to any Thai food lover.  They don't hold back on the flavor. All kinds of lemongrass, basal, and other delicious spicy flavors explode with this dish.

The Green Curry itself, ordered with beef, was one of the best I have had in a very long time.  It was a thin Bangkok style curry with lots of bamboo, green and red peppers, etc.  Any Thai food lover knows that it is hard to find an exceptional Bangkok style green curry.  I think this one has trumped Krung Thai for my favorite green curry in town.  The balance of flavor was again amazing.  Many Thai restaurants either hold back on the spicing ingredients or can't balance them properly.  This place does it right.  The only complaint that I could see maybe is that there wasn't a ton of beef, but to me the curry itself is so good that it doesn't even need it.  A+ green curry right here, folks.

On visit two we had the Roast Duck Curry ($8.95), Larb with Pork ($6.95), Pineapple Fried Rice ($7.95), and Drunken Noodles with chicken ($6.75).  Again, the food was stellar the second time around, and again the Roast Duck Curry stole the show.  It had a strong yet balanced and lightly sweet flavor, very savory while still a thin consistency.  The pineapple tasted fresh, and the duck was of the highest quality.  The only complaint I would have is that there could have been more duck meat, but I would rather have less of a higher quality meat.  The price is certainly right regardless.  The curries here are authentic and balanced at the same time, completely stellar.  

The Pineapple Fried Rice was excellent as well, with a light grilled flavor balanced with the sweetness of fresh pineapple.  The cashews tasted fresh and were absolutely delightful.  The Drunken Noodles (Pad Kee Mow at some other restaurants) was also great.  The Larb was slightly dry for my taste, but very flavorful. It wasn't too sour but definitely had some sourness to it, and had lots of other savory flavors to balance it out.  Most Larbs I have had lately are very one sided in the sour department, but not this one.  Multidimensional flavor seems to be the theme to this place!

I would probably give Thai Food To Go a 4/5 over all, but the curries here are so off the hook that I have to bump this one up to a 5.  I can't express my previous frustration with not being able to find really good, authentic tasting Bangkok style curry in this town.  Thai Food To Go has finally filled that gap for me, and I can't wait to go back. (Note: I was told the place has new owners as of about 6 months ago).
The Thai iced tea, soup, yellow curry with chicken and brown rice along with great service by Champ made for a tasty and enjoyable lunch today.  We'll definitely be back.
This place is excellent. The green curry fried rice is one of my favorites. The chef is always adding seasonal items to the menu. I dont think the name does it justice here.
Authentic delicious thai food! Will definitely be back!

Very authentic, a bit sweet for my taste but that seems to be the
Norm in Thai food these days. No bathroom!!!

Been regular customer here for over 5 years. The food is very tasty and good quality.  They have the kua kling. The spicy southern Thai style dish very authentic. Pad Thai  and fried chicken over fried rice is bomb.  No where can beat this place.  This cozy place only have 4 tables that what there name Thai food to go.  But service is very family. Feel like my mom cook for me at home.

This is a great spot in a very unassuming location.  The tiny storefront hides a world of Thai food that  many will never experience.

I've done take-out twice and delivery a few times - I prefer the delivery.  The take out is fine, though the last time there was a mistake when the guy next to me in line "accidentally" took my food as well as his.  The owner was apologetic and gave me a free Thai iced tea while she remade my order... it was just irritating.

Nonetheless.  The food is amazing.  It's always hot and freshly made, incredibly tasty and flavorful.  We've never ordered anything that we didn't like.  My husband typically orders the Pad Thai and my go-to is the Pad See Ew.  We get heaping helpings that are usually enough for two meals along with the free appetizers for a $20 order.  

Delivery is fast and friendly;  our food is always hot and there are never any issues.  There's no question about if we will eat here again, it's simply a matter of when.


**Edit** Still a great place - but they've done a little remodel inside, which makes it fairly pleasant (they have a wicked-cool mural).  They've added a delivery charge (sigh) and no longer offer the free appetizers with the $20 order.  The food is still awesome, so while disappointing, we won't stop eating there.  :)
Delicious, inexpensive and right near my house. They are nice people, the food is made fast and a lot of variety. One of my favorite quick spots for food to go!

WHAT THAI IS IT?

Thanks to all my fellow Yelpers for leading me to this place especially to the Duke, Shawn J who just happens to be one of my Yelp buddies! Oh, and I cant say enough about Jaime W's review. She hit everything spot on. Also Emily R's review is awesome as well. It was so awesome that she got the ROTD! (Review Of The Day).

So here's my two cents. I actually was thinking about goin to Del Taco. As I pulled in to the parking lot, I see "Thai Food To Go". Hmm....I thought. Isnt this one of my bookmarks? So I check and yup, there it was. So there was no doubt I was eating there.

First impressions are that it's quite cozy, meaning they only have about 5 small tables and not much room for anything else. But you guys know the saying, "Dont judge a good book by it's cover." Im assuming that person has eaten here because the food is absolutely dee-lish.

The have this lunch special from 11 to 3 for 5.50 dine in only. What you get is your choice of meat, steamed or fried rice, soup, and a pot sticker or eggroll. That's awesome for your stomach and your wallet! I chose the Spicy Chicken Basil with a spicy rating of 4. Either im getting soft or my spice buds are deteriorating cuz I was sweating like a pig! Nevertheless, the fried rice, egg flower soup, and pot sticker were scrumptious! You also get a free Thai Iced Tea just for checking in. (dine in only). Of course I still needed water due to the fact I had steam coming from my forehead. I guess the lady saw that and went ahead and got me some water which was well appreciated.

Service was awesome!. From the time I ordered to the time I paid, everything was convenient, well except for the 10 dollar minimum credit/debit card policy. That was a bummer. So you either gotta order more food or pay cash. Most people dont carry cash anymore so hopefully after reading this you will be well aware.

So bookmark this place if you havent already. Im glad I did. Put a little spice in your life!

Chicken pad tai is solid. I go with the medium level of spicyness but to each his own. I plan on trying the monkey noodles next. It's my neighbor go to for Thai. Close proximity and fast service are also very big factors. Will keep updating as I proceed.

Decided to get some thai food while my boyfriend and I were on the Eastside yesterday. Now, I'm pretty picky when it comes to thai food because it's one of my absolute favorite cuisines by far, but we chose this place due to the great reviews. From the outside, Thai Food to Go is definitely a hole-in-the-wall joint. The lady who sat us was very sweet and attentive. We ordered chicken phad thai, panang curry, and the calamari. I was not disappointed.The calamari was tasty and their phad thai was up there with the best I've ever had. The panang was pretty good too. 

If you're looking for a fancy sit down restaurant, this isn't your spot. BUT if you're looking for VERY GOOD, authentic thai food that is also served fairly quick .. this is a must try!

Apparently, their only two flavors are "wallpaper paste" and "ghost pepper surprise." There's no in-between. My wife seems to like it, but that's because it's cheap, and she's ... we'll go with "thrifty". It has all the personality and atmosphere of a Wal-Mart employee break room, and, as my kid will tell you, they don't list everything they have directly on the menu, so, if you don't look closely at the walls, you'll miss the fried ice cream. 

Yeah. Skip it.

As the name suggests, this is not a place that screams nice sit down meal to impress a date located in a run down strip mall on Desert Inn Road, but your aforementioned date would be indubitably impressed if you brought their food over to her place and curled up to watch a nice romantic movie such as Thai-tanic or any within the Thai-light Saga if she happens to be a fan of Thai-lor Larb-ner (my apologies for the pad thai puns, alas it couldn't be helped).

While Archie's and Pin Kao are familiar Thai lunch staples to the Vegas locals, this hidden gem on the east side of town excels in value and authenticity.   To start off, you automatically knock off a few bucks simply by checking in on Yelp and receiving a complementary Thai iced tea, an always refreshingly cool, creamy, and sweet beverage to neutralize even the spiciest of meals.  One then has the options for the $5.95 lunch specials which include choice of main entree, soup of the day, steamed or fried rice, and veggie egg roll or chicken pot sticker.   The standout option is the green curry.  They are not shy on spice, so my advice would be to order at about 5-6 if you like spicy, and titrate upward with the dry chili flakes at your table since that is essentially what they add to increase the spice level.  My experience with 7 or higher is that the spice overpowers the other flavors and it is not a pleasant experience, especially if you are ordering noodles or fried rice since you can at least extinguish some heat from the curries with steamed rice.  

Whereas Pin Kao is heavy handed with the coconut milk and Archie's can be a tad on the oily side, the curries here are remarkably balanced and packed with vibrant and distinct flavors from the herbs and spices.  All the meats and vegetables components are fresh and well-cooked with toothsome textures.
