A few items I've tried off the beaten path include the spicy crab noodle (think vinegary pad thai with bits of spicy crab), thai bbq chicken served with a side of papaya salad and sticky rice (aptly named "the three buddies", there's probably a food porn joke somewhere in here involving the words threesome and sticky, but I will keep this review PG), and the crispy fried pork (good flavors but way too salty).  The noodle soups are unmemorable and the one dish to avoid at all costs is the mee krob.  I've been wanting to try a solid rendition of mee krob (roughly translates to "crispy noodles") which is akin to hong kong style pan-fried noodles topped with a meat/vegetable starchy gravy but having a sweet acidic component and using rice noodles instead of egg noodles, yet the rendition here uses cheap chow mein noodles and drowned with a msg-laden sauce that reminds me of a premium bowl of cup-o-ramen.  I'm going to pretend this dish never happened.  Based on other yelper's photos, the whole fried tilapia topped with a spicy mango relish and the mango sticky rice look pretty legit so they are on the agenda for future visits.  All in all, a solid local mom/pop Thai joint that is easy on the wallet, loaded with authentic flavors,  and hits the spot if you are looking for a quick bite or as a solid take out option on the east side of town.

Let me start by saying this restaurant is best for carry-out with limited seating if you choose to dine in. Today I ordered their spring rolls for my appetizer and they came in the rice paper (still feeling nostalgic about the crunch and peanut sauce). For my main course, I ordered the beef salad and fried chicken fried rice.

Dishes that are WINNERS:
Chinese brocoli & crispy fried pork which is amazing
Spicy Catfish - boneless fried catfish with fresh vegetables in a light spicy sauce
Chinese sausage & bbq pork fried rice - seasoned perfectly
Beef Salad- tender pieces of beef with an array of veggies 
Fried chicken over fried rice- The chicken is juicy and not overdone and the rice has onions and tomato's. 

Everything I've tried here is a winner so far in my book. I'll be sure to try "three buddies" next time since a lot of people say its good.

I am from Thailand and have lo tolerance for bad Thai food. This is a place run by Thais and the host/ Owner does a great job with this casual take out or dine in local buzz spot. He is from San Francisco where his family runs a highly acclaimed thai reataurant that's sort of an institution. Green and red Penang curry were sumptuous, heady and beautifully crafted. Pad see ew noodles was savory and thick. Even the pot stickers were tasty (Thai people rarely eat this, but it was good)

Ambiance of a fast food restaurant and small.

The 7 guys i took there couldnt stop talking about this meal 2-3 days later.
Took my mom to lunch at this restaurant, and the food is still killer, but they killed off the lunch specials.    Don't get me wrong, I'm still coming back.

This is a super late review but I HAD to tell my fellow yelpers how amazing the food here is! Last June I planned a Vegas Bachelorette Weekend for my best friend's sister. The group of about 12 girls stayed in penthouse & adjoining suites at the fabulous Platinum Hotel Las Vegas. Everyone checked into the hotel on Saturday and were set to check out on Sunday. Games & male exotic dancer were all set for early evening in the main suite before the group headed out for their VIP Club Tour & Limo Bus. Since the bachelorette party would be in the suite, the bride requested to have her favorite food catered for dinner. Platinum hotel rooms have LARGE kitchen space with wrap-around counters and dining table...and the penthouse space was perfect for the dinner. I immediately went to yelp since i'm from LA and not familiar with local restaurants...I called Thai Food To Go a few days before arriving to Vegas and told them of our budget for food for the party...they were more than accommodating and agreed to deliver the food. I don't remember the name of the person I spoke to, but he delivered the food ON TIME himself and everything was DELICIOUS!!!! All of the guests were so pleased with everything we ordered (Pad Thai, Pineapple Fried Rice, Yellow Curry, etc.)...and most importantly the bride was thrilled! There was SO much food left over that the girls continued to eat everything the next day for breakfast/ lunch lol

I absolutely loved this place. I am so happy to have finally found a great place that is very close to home, for a quick bite that does not compromise in quantity or quality. The service was very refreshing. The man taking our order was very helpful even with a bit of a language barrier. 

Of course I started out with a free Thai tea that comes with a Yelp check-in. My SO and I ordered an entr√©e of the chicken pad Thai noodles and yellow curry with chicken which came with a side of steamed rice. The meat and veggies were plentiful and delicious!  We like our spice on more of the milder side. On a scale of 1-10 for spice, we asked for our dishes to be at a #4 for the noodles and a #2 for the curry. I think the noodles were still pretty spicy! We didn't mind. It was still very yummy!

It is, however, very small! Consider take-out for larger groups rather than dining-in. I was very relieved to find it empty on a Sunday evening because I was expecting it to be packed like I've read in previous reviews. Definitely recommend this place and will be back again!

I'm a little disappointed in this place they're Tom Yum Soup smelled rancid and it had way too much going on. So many onions and other things I wasn't expecting from a Tom Yum Soup. The Beef sew yew  was too sweet and not savory and their pad Thai was decent. For how much I paid I expected to at least get a side order of steam rise with my purchase but didn't even get that. I'm gonna stick with LOTUS OF SIAM no one is as good as them.
The food is okay. I would not recommend getting Yum Tom soup with seafood. The freshness of the fish was questionable  on the positive note it was a quick pick up and flavor was good.

Small dine in area. Outstanding prices. Friendly staff. Yeah, I'll be coming back here. First time had the pad see eu. Outstanding! It was love at first bite.

Despite being a complete hole in the wall the place is very clean. I'm very satisfied with the quality of the food and service. Thanks for existing, guys!
I moved here from California and love the traditional Thai food, I been looking and had  try a lot of restaurants. We had found it. It's Thai food to go... Great food ;-)
I love their pineapple shrimp curry and the crab rangoons! Seating is super limited like 5 tables but it's really clean and everyone is really friendly!

Great neighborhood place. Seats 16, so not for crowds. Food was fresh, all of the Thai classics are available, vegan/vegetarian offerings abound. 

Had pad woon sen and pad thai. Great flavors, everything fresh.

And it's really inexpensive.

Great taste and really tastes like ThAi! Had Chow Mein and Pad Thai. Kinda funny because I just started eating and didn't even notice till half way that I was eating the wrong plate. I was like, "Why doesn't this Pad thai not taste like Pad thai yet?!" Then I noticed I was eating Chow mein Lawl! 

  The chow mein tastes great like real made chow mein with a warm taste. It's not all dry and doesn't feel like it's been warmed up several times. Plus The flavanoids were there. The Pad Thai had that great taste as usual. Not all tasteless that only brings the dryness, but brings the flavor along. Only complaint I had was that the room was waaay to warm inside.

It's close to work. I've always seen it but been to busy to stop by.

Went for lunch. It was fast and yummy. Plus the several lunch specials are only $4.99 (drink extra.) Got out of there for $7. Family place, good service.

I'm not thai expert but I plan to go back, often.
Great prices, food fresh and great tasting.  If you like spicy they can make it spicy.  One of the best Thai food places in vegas.  Will definitely be going back

First time ordering. Had it delivered. All three of us at home really, really enjoyed it. We got the green curry chicken, sweet and sour chicken, rice and a soft drink. I give the food and flavors a ten.

Portions! 

That day I decided to stray away from Thai St. Cafe was a good decision. Doesn't hurt to try new locations. 
Family owned and ran, this place was very inviting. Walked in and had no pressure in ordering. We got recommendations on what was popular or what the guy taking our order preferred. 
We ended up getting pad see ew (I always judge a Thai place by this for this is what I mainly order), yellow curry, and garlic, pepper crispy pork.
The crispy pork was probably better eaten right away. Had a lot of flavor. A little bit on the saltier side for me but perfect with a side of rice. 
I shouldn't have let the girl order for she got shrimp in the yellow curry. Should've stuck with chicken or beef. Curry was good. Had a nice serving of vegetables in it. 
The pad see ew was good. A lot of noodles. Better portion size than most places. 
Overall this would be a go to for now on this side of town.
That food was the worst that I have ever ordered!! The thai ice tea tasted like coffee grounds, i.e. MUD.  Disgusting food.

Damn this food is good! We ordered to go since we just moved to the area and this was a great welcoming gift. We got the tofu pad see ew, chicken panang curry, and spicy mint.

I pretty much judge my Thai food on how willing they are to make my food super spicy. I asked for an 8 and it was perfect. I should remind myself to not go higher next time but I know I'll be tempted. The spicy mint was great, there was a ton of ground chicken and this was probably the spiciest of the dishes. Pad see ew is just a classic and they gave us a tonnn of noodles which made me happy because this is usually the first dish we finish. The panang curry was the only slight disappointment. The curry was pretty watery and I don't usually like green beans in my curries. Other random highlight: the chili paste they give you is really spicy. Like I'm going to save it in my fridge and use it on everything because I love it. Can't wait to try more and excited that I'm in the delivery area!
OMG the food was great!! Fast service and quick delivery. Thank you, guys. Definitely ordering from here again.

We ordered three items. Two very good... One not so much... The potsticker appetizer was very good!! I would be tempted to make a meal of those! The crispy pork with Chinese broccoli was ehhhhhh-- would not order it again-- figure that was a mistake order!! For dessert, we had the mango and sticky rice-- it was very good!! 
We will come again and try other entrees.
The check-in Thai tea was fair... Okay for the price.
Super yummy Thai food! Especially loved the Thai beef salad  , Pad Thai, and spring rolls completed our dinner. Really enjoyed our meal, thank you!

This place was sooooo good. I had the crab fried rice and spring rolls. It was perfect. Authentic Thai food. The service was just okay, but I believe that was due to a culture/language block. I'll definitely be back. Aaaaaaand they deliver!
.

Pricing is pretty cheap and the amount you get is good size.  I love the fact that they do delivery since I'm here in vegas for business and I didn't have a car to go around.  I ordered the 3 buddies, Tom yum noodles and chicken phadthai. The food was sooo good in already thinking about ordering more.  The 3 buddies came with sticky rice,  papaya salad and bbq chicken.  I was kind of skeptical about ordering bbq chicken because sometimes people would overcook it and the meat would get tough but this place knows how to do it right.  The chicken was juicy and tender.  I would definitely order again and keep in mind about this place next time I come back to vegas.

Oh my goodness! I thought it wasn't going to be that amazing but I have not had this good of Thai Food in god knows how long. Eating in San Diego, Texas and Florida their Thai food has nothing on this little hole in the wall. No matter what you do in Vegas you have got to stop by here and try the food. Place is so nice, quaint and chill but their food is out of this world and spicy. Which is really what we all want when we are eating Thai. Try it, Love it, Pass on the good!

Awesome take-out experience! 

I definitely plan to come back! I ordered on the eat24 Yelp app. The food was ready quickly. When I arrived the couple operating the place immediately greeted me. They were very attentive and got my order to me before I could even ask for it. They also noticed I was a new customer and were very nice! I got the sense that they must have a really high rate of return customers and I can see why.

Now the food... I ordered Pad Thai. The portion was large with a good amount of chicken. The taste was awesome and just what I was looking for.

I really like the packaging too. They put the noodles on a tin foil so none of the sauce leaks out and they give you a side of hot sauce and utensils without having to ask.

I only tried one dish so far, but I'm looking forward to trying more!

Outstanding Thai food on the East side and at the cheapest prices I've ever seen! Thank you to Yelper Shawn J's review for leading me to gold.

Normally I wait to write a review until after I have at least two dining experiences, but today I can't wait. Zero patience when it comes to spreading the good word about good food.

 5 STAR FLAVOR. $5.50 (Lunch Special Prices) Green Curry Chicken at 10 for heat level. Overall it was some of the best Green Curry I've encountered and the heat level was spot on. Nice balance of white meat chicken to vegetables and loaded with chiles. It's going to be hard for me to try anything else because it was that good.

 5 STAR SERVICE. The lady who helped me gets 5 stars just for her smile. She lit up the small restaurant with her smile and positive attitude.  Her spirit is contagious and I wish my coworkers could be more like her. I had a real funny thing I wrote right here about that, but thought it would be in my best interest to keep it to myself. (That's growth)

Why only 4 STARS you ask? 
1. Because I've only eaten here once and I am not going to high five a spot until I have tasted more of the menu.
2. This place is REALLY small. It was clean and bright, but it's just too small. Definitely not first date worthy unless the person is really cool and really loves Thai food and you. Then it would be ideal. 

I forgot to mention if you check in on Yelp you get a free Thai Tea if you are dining in. 

Thai Food To Go is not to be missed. One of the most flavorful, top quality meals around for 5 bucks. I might go back tomorrow to try the Pumpkin Curry on special right now!
Very good, simple thai food. Very fresh ingredients. Love the beef basil/mint with veggies. Good green curry too.
Pad Thai and Pad See Eu were delicious!!! Only bad thing is they close @ 9pm. Maybe because its Monday. Thai Tea was also spot on....prices are super friendly.
The vegetable rolls were so good! The orange chicken was amazing.  I am recommending it as a go-to spot for folks who like simply good good.
Literally one of the best Thai places in town. If you haven't been it's a must!! So much flavor in every bite. Favorite plates are Thai fried rice , chow mein or Pad Thai.

Wonderful food, terrible ambiance. Better for take-out, as the name would suggest. 
Fantastic eggplant, beautiful curries, great drunken noodles. Swallow your capsaicin pride and order a notch low on the 1-10 scale; they don't mess around. The thai iced tea was not as good as I hoped, but it was free with a checkin, so I can't complain.

Four stars overall for fantastic food minus terrible ambiance. You're going to a restaurant to eat, after all.

This place is amazing, Yelp didn't let us down. Really reasonable prices, fresh delicious food, awesome Thai ice tea. I've had the Pad Thai, Drunken noodles and pineapple fries rice - all are to die for. We always get the thai iced tea too, perfect amount of sweetness. Get the pot stickers as an appetizer, they're delish!!
You definitely won't regret a trip here!

Small cozy place, but the food is very delicious and has a lot to offer! Called in to place an order for the Pad See Ew, and I was told it would be ready in 5 minutes. Showed up about 10 minutes later and my food was already waiting for me. It was still very hot when I got home, so I know it was freshly made and not sitting around for a while. The Pad See Ew was excellent! Have no complaints. The spicy sauce they provide you is also very delicious. I also ordered a Large Thai Tea which was served in a large serving container rather than a large cup, but it served its purpose. I would definitely recommend this place for anyone looking for quick delicious Thai food.

This is my favorite Thai place in Las Vegas. I've tried a lot of Thai places and this is hands down, the best I've had yet. The food is seasoned and the prices and portions are a plus. I also LOVE supporting local business and this is one of them. No frills in the dining area, the food is the gem. 

PROS:
Chinese brocoli & crispy fried pork
Spicy Catfish - boneless fried catfish with fresh vegetables in a light spicy sauce
Chinese sausage & bbq pork fried rice - seasoned perfectly
Pork eggrolls - packed with meat and fresh fried
Service - with a Thai smile
Prices & Lunch Special menu
Free Thai tea with Yelp check in

CONS:
If you eat inside you'll notice the place could use a facelift (it looks more like a carry out)
One of fav to go to or have delivered.  Great helpings, spices on point!!  I always get the curry tho my friend had the chicken before and loved it.  Literally order anything
Very Good food! We are half thai family and the flavors are very authentic. Will come back on our drive back to phx. No bathrooms available

I love this place! I always order from them. The pineapple fried rice, pad thai and curries are delicious. So far, every order I have received arrives quickly and is always hot and very tasty. I highly recommend this restaurant.

They deliver food if you stay in any hotels nearby. One of the best Thai restaurants I have tried. Everything we ordered was good. 
I got the yellow curry with duck and it was the bomb!! My family tried it and everyone agreed that the flavor was on point. I had it spicy at 5/10 and it was enough to have the kick and still taste curry, coconut and spice in it. 
My mom got the drunken noodles, my husband got the rad na noodles and my son got the pad see ew. They all love their dishes. 
We also got the tom yum and mango sticky rice with coconut and Thai tea. They were all delicious and we finished everything.
Service was great and friendly. There are two gentlemen (i think they are owners) that run the restaurant. They checked on us often and filed our water. We had a conversation with one of them about the food and culture. Five stars for service and food!!
We will definitely recommend this place to everyone. Definitely come back next time!

My first time eating here was amazing! Everything tasted savory and their service is so kind. The only downside is their dine in is a bit small and hot due to the cooking in the back. It's better to just order your food "to go". However I will definitely come back here!

Yet another thai place that serves fake thai food. I'd bet $10,000 that the mushrooms they use are those oyster mushrooms out of a can. I did actually enjoy the drunken noodles but not enough noodles. Oh, and I called before ordering & asked if they had dairy-free thai tea to which they replied yes. But all that REALLY means is no milk. So no, they do not carry ANY dairy-free milk alternatives for vegans which is lame, lame, LAME!
The food here is great . The prices are great. The people are really nice. I would do take out because of limited seating. My favorites are the crispy wings ,veggie tofu and the pineapple fried rice.
food was good as always . papaya salad last time wasn't taste the same as before
The food is good, tables are a little bit small if you eat with 4 people, the service is okay.

MIND. BLOWN.

This unassuming little place might not look like its fancy peers, but who needs fancy when your food is this good!!

I have to say, Yelp stars were on point for this one. If I had just based it on looks, then I may have passed this gem over. But guys, I am dead serious. This is some of the best Thai food I have ever tasted!! I know I have only been here once, but I just had to shout it from the rooftops about how awesome the food is.

My boyfriend decided to treat me to dinner, and I chose Thai. But he was actually the one that found Thai Food To Go (thanks Yelp App!). Upon pulling up in the parking lot, we didn't even really see it at first, because the strip mall it's in looks empty. We drove over to the other side, and that's when we actually saw the front of the restaurant.

Inside, there are only a few small tables. Barely enough room to order your to-go food, even! I recommend staying there and eating. I actually really enjoined the no-frills, mellow vibe the place had going for it.

To start, we ordered the Spring Rolls. They have both chicken and shrimp in them. I remember once I ordered the same thing at Lotus of Siam before, and it was a bunch of money wasted for these puny little rolls. Not here. You get a good sized portion and some of that sweet vinegar dipping sauce with the nuts in it, all for the same price, maybe even cheaper! 

For our main dishes, I chose the Pumpkin Curry, which was on special for around $7.95. My bf ordered the Duck Curry, spicy. Both of our currys looked beautiful upon arrival! Mine had large chunks of chicken and perfectly cooked pumpkin pieces. Not too soft, not too hard. The duck curry also had large meat pieces in it, along with tomato and pineapple.  Bf said that his was not as spicy as he had wanted it, but that was his only real negative thing to say (plus, they have more spices and sauces on the table if you need it).

To finish off, I got the Mango and Sweet Rice dessert. Soooo guuuuud. 

We both had a Thai Iced tea, and they were very, very sweet. I loved it.

This is my official favorite Thai food place in town! Be careful. If you do decide to go, it might ruin all other local Thai food experiences for you... But I'm sure Thai Food To Go wouldn't mind that at all!

This place is amazing. A true authentic thai food restaurant.  However, we always order for delivery.   Delivery service always on time and always kind customer service.  Food always at its best... never fails to please the palate.  Garlic crispy wings ... oh so geeeeewd, a must try.

I have had the Pad See Ew, yellow curry, Pad Thai, the sweet tea, and one other thing with noodles on the side and a big cup of soup. I liked it all, the Pad Thai wasn't the best I have ever had, but it wasn't bad. I really like their fried rice. It doesn't seem fried at all though. Its got a pink color, it's sticky, and it has a very different, but tasty flavor. The prices are reasonable, the portions are generous, and everything is cooked fresh to order. Try it, you won't be disappointed!

While the food is pretty great it was very disappointing that when I asked the cashier what a certain dish was made up of he replied with "I have no idea". In my opinion and experience in customer service you should know what your selling and what it has and if not you should try to find out. Overall that was very disappointing. Need better informed workers. :(

This place has some of the best Pad Thai (my favorite) noodles that I have had in a long time. I ordered the one with crab in it. The best part is that the noodles werent too oily (like in many other Thai places) I will definitely order from here again, too bad they dont open any sooner.

The food here is really good and I am picky and very critical with food.  It's very good, refreshing, and good prices!
Come and try it, you will have a new favorite place to eat.
Enjoy!
dont order food for delivery because it took over 2 hrs to deliver my food n they are only 2 miles away from me

Came to this place with my sister and she wanted to see how fast they'd make our food ordering online to go, even though we were already in the restaurant lol so we did and they made it real quick. We took it go to because it was getting late but I say there food was really good. My sister ordered a bunch of stuff but I got the drunken fried rice with beef. I can honestly say I've been to many Thai places and tried there fried rice and there's always something I didn't like especially there beef. But this place hit the spot. Bomb Fried Rice..And I love how big there Thai Tea to go is lol Love it.

Got this delivered today: panang curry, egg rolls, pad thai, papaya salad, and tom yum soup (chicken). The flavors were spot on and definitely had that street food vibe. Notables: The curry was perfectly spicy and dense, egg rolls were light and expertly cooked, the tom yum soup had a nice blend of sweet and sour, and the pad Thai was savory/sweet/spicy in great combination. Highly recommended!

Very pleased with the service. Friendly, attentive, and fast. I had vegetable egg rolls and Pad Thai. Pad Thai was exquisite. Not too oily or too dry, just perfect. Just the right amount of food on the plate, the tofu was baked to perfection and made the flavor stand out. The egg rolls were crispy but not over fried and not oily either.  Definitely coming back and recommending it to friends.

Delicious and cheap, the one drawback to this place is it has no public restroom even for customers, which for a place with hot and spicy foods is a little awkward. Additionally, it is in kind of a shady area.

I've had a few dishes here. I think my favorites are the pad see ew spicy 7-8, and the dumplings with those sauces on them. They have good solid flavors, large portions, and quick service, keys to having a small "to go" style restaurant.

If it wasn't so out of the way, I'd definitely be a regular here, but even then we make the drive sometimes.

Great prices and great food! Couldn't get much better than that.

I asked for my dish to be #2 spicy on a scale of 1-10, 10 being the spiciest and I thought it was pretty spicy but maybe it was just me.

Best Thai food I've ever had. Hands down. Everything was perfect. Service was on point. I don't remember what we got, but I'm pretty sure it's one of those places where it really does not matter because everything is mind blowing. I was there with my best friend in the whole wide world, her birthday is today, and a pretty chill dude. I guess you could say the company was just as good as the food. Alright, so the food wins. But the company was definitely up there. HAPPY BIRTHDAY!
The food was great. Amazing and friendly service. The fried banana ice cream is the best! Will be coming back here!

Pretty good food at very reasonable prices. Nice,Friendly service and quick. Close to my office, so it' s convenient. Went back 2x already. A tiny bit greasy but they don't claim to be "healthy" so, I can't complain. Lunch specials are a real good deal. Location and atmosphere are less than desirable but again, it's close to my office so i don't mind.

I love this place.  My coworkers and I order from there probably 2-3 times a week on the high end, but at least once a week usually.  Food is always amazingly delicious and still hot when it gets delivered to us.  Depending on who is cooking, be conservative with your spicy level selection.  It's a scale of 1-10 but unless you're used to turning purple, losing all sensation on your tongue and sweating while you eat, keep it under a 5.

Highly recommended, if you like good Thai food and don't care for fancy table settings and ambiance.

A diamond in the rough!!  I was so hungry and ate my food so fast that I forgot the name of the noodle dish I ate!!  Butttt, if it was any indication of how their noodle dishes are then I must say it's a must have when you are craving thai food.  The only thing I do remember was the friendliness of the staff and the fact that my crab dish had actual crab in it (not the imitation kind).  Looking forward to coming back here and grubbing on some other dishes.  Check it out!!

This hole in the wall is not to be missed!  I came here for lunch. The place is really small about 4 or 5 tables. Lunch wasn't that busy today. I ordered the green curry with pork. It comes with your choice of steam rice or fried rice and egg roll or pot sticker. I recommended the pot sticker. So tasty! Last but not least a salad too! All for $5.00! The food was so flavorful and the spice was just right. I got a level 4. The portion was a decent size amount. If you choose to dine in you get a free Thai tea! Well definitely be back for more!
Sorry, but state law requires you to offer a PUBLIC RESTROOM for customers. I had to go to another restaurant. I will report this to Nevada Health Department.

Ordered delivery tonight: after reading the reviews online I ordered salmon panang and pad see ewe with tofu (personal favorite). The salmon was extremely dry, harder than fried tofu, with no flavor. The panang itself was good, and next time I'll have to order it with tofu instead. The pad see ewe was great, and I will definitely order again. A convenient and decent option when looking for cheap delivery Thai. Friendly service as well. (Delivered on time - 40 min)
Great little hole in the for us eastiders! Friendly staff. Awesome eats especially if you're hungover. great option for Mexican when hunover.
Had the pad see ew.  It was very tasty but i definitely have had better and numerous thai restaurants.  Great deal/quality for the price!

10-11-2015  Thai Food To Go is a very small place with great food.  My favorite is Tom Yum Noodle soup.  There are only about 5 tables, I think most of their orders are for delivery but this small place puts out some excellent food.

I love me some Thai food!
Very yummy. We dined in, but be prepared the restaurant is small. As the name says, Thai Food To Go.
Was not disappointed. The food was very good. The portions were generous. Best of all, you can get it to go and it is quality.
Bring an empty belly, you will fill it here!
Yumm!

Cheap take out that turned out to be pretty good. Ordered off of Yelp (super easy and convient) and picked it up 15 min later. 

We got

#10 Fried Calamari: It was alright. Texture was a bit softer than I'm use too. I've had better but typically this is something I order at a sit-down type place. 

#26 Papaya Salad: Had potential but fell a bit short for me. The flavors were there but I feel like it needed a little something else. Maybe some purple onion  and slices of the fruit.

#44 Spicy Green Beans: Enjoyed it. Had a bit of spice but wasn't overpowering. Would have liked more veggies but the carrots green beans and bell peppers went well together. I asked for Brown rice in place of the typical white and was charged $1.50 to upgrade.

C4 Roasted Duck Curry: Wasn't my order but I tried a little. Was to sweet for my liking though dad liked it a lot. 

#1 Vegetarian Egg Rolls: We got this appetizer added to our order free of charge. Weren't overly greasy/oily and were tasty enough. 

Overall it was a solid experience. Good food, quick and easy.

If you happen to be in town, and you're looking for authentic thai food. This is the place to go! 

Delicious authentic thai food and their drinks are tasty, too!

The flavor is very authentic and the spice level is pretty intense, so if you do not like super spicy food, be sure to let them know.  The prices are very reasonable, portion sizes are large, and the service is very speedy. The food came out right away and everything was cooked to perfection. This place is definitely a hidden gem!

I am definitely adding this to my favorite spots in Las Vegas!

This is the best Thai food in Vegas.  Wonderful service and fantastic food.  You get the real Thai flavors with just the right amount of spices.  So glad we gave this place a try.  The spicy basil beef is so tasty.  You have to try the pork potstickers they're to die for.
Love this place. Authentic thai food is hard to find. The coconut (thom ka?) soup is amazing!

This place is beyond amazing. I came in on a whim to see how this place is and my expectations were completely blown away. This is easily the best authentic thai cousine that ive had in the US. The food is at least 10x better than any restaurant that costs 4 times as much. I had to come back the next day immediately because i cant get over how good the food was. GO to this place now, u can thank me later.
This is the best Thai food! Their potstickers are outrageous. Can't get enough of this place. Great for takeout.

Great flavor and on the spicy side.  I normally order medium hot or number 5 from any thai place.  This places version of number 5 is more like a 7 or 8.  It was very yummy.  The pot stickers were also great.  Everyone inside was very friendly and helpful.

My bf and I went here. I thought it was good and enjoyed myself here. He's been to Thailand several times and kept exclaiming over how authentic it was. So if you really like Thai food, and you want it authentic, this is a good place to try. I wish we could have tried some of the desserts my bf kept talking about, but they were out (mango with sticky rice was out of season). He definitely wants to go back, so I guess I'll get my chance later   :)
Love their panang curry with duck and drunken noodles. They offer free Thai tea with yelp check in.

Affordable and good. Plus u get a free Thai tea with check in. Yum!
for the money and service, its lower 5 stars :)

Whenever I'm craving Thai I always come here. It's a tiny hole in the wall restaurant that has friendly service and authentic Thai/Lao food at a very affordable price. I recommend their beef larb spicy #7. I get it every time and am never disappointed.

We stopped here last night in between two places we needed to be.  I knew from reading the reviews on Yelp that it was a small place and it is!  There are 5 tables that hold a total of 14 people.  I guess that's why it's named well and they had a number of take out visits while we were there.

I checked the daily specials board and saw pumpkin curry.  I ordered it with chicken, spice level 7 on a 1 to 10 scale.  My wife got her standard pepper and garlic chicken which does not have a spice level.  We also got an order of vegetarian egg rolls.  

Everything was very good.  The egg rolls were very good and were delivered very hot to our table.  The pumpkin curry was something very different for me and I'd certainly get it again.  I tasted my wife's chicken and it, too, was good and she liked it.  Unlike what she's used to at other Thai restaurants, Thai For To Go deep fries the chicken briefly--no coating--just enough to give a bit of crispness and cooking to the chicken.  

A couple of small things.  Being so small, the tables are small.  We would have been better off sitting at one of the two tables for four people because there almost wasn't enough room for the dishes on the table.  Also, we had our egg rolls for about 2 minutes when she came out with our main dishes.  Perhaps I need to ask people to wait, but I really like some time to enjoy the appetizer before having to start the main course.  Again, due to its size, there's no customer bathroom available without going through the kitchen.  We didn't use the bathroom but we noticed one of the customers going into the kitchen to get there.

It's a good value for the good food.  I hope to get back.  If it were on the west side of town I'd be there more often but it's almost to Boulder Highway.
This place one of to go for, especially when you and family wants to have a good thai food in affordable way but delicious, and I guarantee you, they will smile with happy belly!

I love this place.

It's so small which is probably why they named the restaurant Thai food to go lol

They don't even have a bathroom! 

It seats like 12.

Anyways we always get take out from here for lunch at my office.

They can make anything a lunch special if you ask nicely for like $6 dollars.

Aside from that their entree portions are big especially for the cost and the food is really good.

They have gone through different owners which helped them. I heard they once were owned by the same "Thai style noodle house" people. They even have a few of their staples like the pot stickers, the Tom yum noodle soup, and the crispy chicken over fried rice. I'd say the Tom yum at noodle house is still a lot better.

Their yellow, green, and duck curry is good. All of their dishes are good. The fried rice, the noodle dishes, the soups. 

The only thing I don't recommend is their pad Thai =\ sorry. But who gets pad Thai at a Thai restaurant anyways? :P 

For the food and cost you can't really beat this place. 

If you can do it then I definitely suggest dining in even though the restaurant name might suggest otherwise.

Delicious, cheap, and fast. I ordered 4 things last night like 20 minutes before they closed and they were super nice about it and the food was ready in less than 15 mins! Lotus of Who(whom)? This place is my go-to Thai.

Got the cashew chicken, potstickers, and Thai tea. 

Cashew chicken lacked flavor, but was enough to feed 2-3 people.

Potstickers were absolutely delicious! 

It was my first time having Thai tea, but certainly will not be my last. 

Overall, I think I got the wrong entree but will be back to try what else they offer.

The worst pad thai ever!

I ordered online and I was so disappointed I asked everyone at work to try it and they just threw it away 

I love food and I eat out all the time and big fan of yelp after i saw the good rating I thought it would be okay. 
If anyone thinks this place is good, you must try Panna Thai restaurant, it taste just like you are in Thailand.

First of all I don't know why someone gave this place 2 stars because they were grossed out that "you could see the kitchen from the dining area" Seeing the kitchen? - usually considered a good thing that they can't hide anything. That being said, this place has been clutch for me on multiple occasions. It's open til 10pm, rare for this side of town, and they dont overcharge you like a lot of other thai food places in Vegas. Pad thai is solid. Coconut soup had a bit too much lime and not enough milk.

[QUICK UPDATE 9/15/16: Too lazy to update fully, but there are so many awesome noodle dishes here. To date, I've tried pad thai, pad see ew, pad woon sen, khua kai, drunken noodles. Can't go wrong with any of them and the pork that's among the non-premium choices.]

They say that all good things must come to an end. Unfortunately, that has finally happened to the $5.95 weekday lunch special at Thai Food To Go.

I hadn't visited this restaurant for a few months, and I just learned today that they're no longer offering their lunch special, which includes a reasonable selection of different entrees, the option to sub in a very basic fried rice instead of white rice, a fried chicken potsticker (or veggie egg roll, but who eats that stuff?), and a small bowl of soup. I'm definitely going to miss the egg drop soup and the sour soup, which I don't even see on the menu. I'll have to inquire next time about whether they'll still make it.

I ended up ordering the beef pad thai today. I'd never had it before because it wasn't on the lunch specials menu. It's a generous portion and comes with crushed peanuts and fresh bean sprouts. I have to say that it was a little strong on the fish sauce and just a little lacking in meat. I would definitely suggest not ordering pad thai and pad see eu here.

However, this is not one of those mopey "oh I had one bad experience so my review/rating is going to invalidate all of the good meals that I've had." No, Thai Food To Go has given me countless enjoyable lunches, and it's still the same folks and the same food. The menu is still priced the same, starting at $6.95 for basic entrees including your choice of tofu, beef, or the not-very-appealing-cuts of pork and chicken that they use in many dishes here.

So what should you order with your beef? From what I've experienced with the lunch specials, the curries are awesome. For a long time, I was on a rotation of red curry (spicier than the others), yellow curry (more potato-y than the others), and panang curry (similar to red but milder). The green curry that didn't captivate me as strongly, but feel free to give it a go. I also enjoyed the spicy basil, which is basically code for "it's sweet and you can still customize the spice level" (they work on a 1-10 scale, by the way).

Salmon panang curry is another skip due to the dry salmon. BBQ chicken, another former lunch special, is definitely worth a try. This chicken comes on the bone, and the meat is charred. I prefer the sweet and sour sauce, but I think it's normally served with a spicy sauce. Lastly, I'd say the fried rice dishes are also worth your time. I had a fried rice once. I think it was the pineapple fried rice. Adding the fish sauce from the table-side condiment basket made it a real treat.

In a way, I'm also glad that I'll have more leeway to try explore the rest of the menu and occasionally try different restaurants' lunch specials. I'll definitely still come back to Thai Food To Go when the craving for a curry strikes, but I'll surely miss what was once an utterly amazing deal.

not one of my best experiences here. While the food was awesome and all along with the nice wall and nice staff, a few days later, I was really sick, and I was throwing up. Along with my dad he also was sick and threw up, and I also had a fever with that, but maybe I just have a weak stomach, but I really wanted to like this place.

This place would be a solid 5 if it weren't for no customer bathroom and they always bring out the entrees too early while I'm enjoying my appetizers. The first time I was there they came out at the same time. Good food made fresh at a VERY reasonable price.

Bad service .the lady who picked up the phone. Don't even care about customers. I always ordered from them when I came this town.today was bad experience. I am not going to order any more. Sucks service

Small little restaurant with a total of five (5) tables. So ten (10) seats total. I decided to sit center of the mural (note photos) cuz it's just so darn cool!!!!! I just love the Thai versions of coca cola, sprite, and fanta-oh I do wanna fanta fanta!!!

Anyway, they have a yelp offer for a free Thai tea if you dine in which I am so happily enjoying right now. 

I ordered the usual Thai garb: Tom kha (coconut soup), beef salad, and pad Thai. Let me say you either know how to make good thai food or ya don't and this place DEFINITELY knows how!!!! 

tom kha: 
doesn't get any better! I think there was a total of 5-6 shrimp which is about normal. You can get either beef or chicken but I always get this coconut soup with shrimp

Pad thai: 
Just the right amount of each fixin'. Sometimes I get upset if I don't get enough peanuts! lol One thing that did bum me was that my noodles got cold fast. Not that it showed up cold, I probably couldn't stop gabbing with the Bestie.

As for the beef salad, Homegirl ordered that and wanted it a 5 on a 1-10 scale. I can't handle hot food so I didn't eat any of it but it sure looked yummy! (refer to photos).

But my overall impression is that this restaurant is beyond accommodating and extremely friendly. We showed up relatively late: me 945pm and my Bestie 1021pm (no joke). This place closes at 1030p. They still allowed us in with no pushback or attitude, remained smily and friendly, served us and a matter of fact waited AFTER it closed down for us. However we didn't take advantage of their kindness and was out the door by 1040p. 

I'll definitely come here again when I'm craving some thai goodness. They deserve my patronage!
Not much of a dining room, but great, authentic food. I've enjoyed their take out on several occasions....I especially liked  their Shrimp Pad Thai, fried calamari, and pot stickers.

After over a year of searching we finally found a great Thai food restaurant here in Vegas :) My daughter and I ordered:  Green Papaya Salad, Pad See Ew with Chicken and an order of Potstickers. Everything was delicious!! The restaurant itself is small & quaint and very clean. I was also Impressed at how clean the condiment containers were, no sticky residue or build up. The girl who waited on us was friendly and attentive. Our food came out shortly after ordering. I live on the opposite side of town but they are definitely worth the drive  :)

They have really awesome thai food here. I went here based on the previous reviews and I was not let down. Thanks so much yelpers for pointing out this place as having really good food. This is some of the best thai food that I've ever had.
We had the drunken noodles and calamari - absolutely delicious and spicey.
My wife also had the mango and sticky rice for dessert - she loved it.
They have really large thai iced-tea for 2.99.
You won't go wrong at this place. 
Just remember, it only has 5 tables, so you may want to order takeout if you have a
large party. 
It's small and looks like a hole-in-the-wall, but don't let that scare you - you'll be glad
that you went there.

I'm so confused right now. I was expecting some bomb Thai food with all these 4 and 5 star reviews, but was sorely disappointed. Ordered for pickup for yesterday's lunch. I got the fried calamari and beef pad see ew. When I arrived, there was a lady right behind the counter, barefoot, feet on the chair.  When she saw me she gave me a nice smile, then continued happily eating her lunch hahaha. 

The calamari was overcooked, but the batter was somehow not cooked all the way through. It also had an off smell to it, according to my coworkers (and they're used to some weird smells in the break room). The pad see ew was flavorless,  and I found a nice little surprise at the end too - a long curly hair mmmm.
This nice "to go" Thai food place has excellent food and reasonable prices.  I ordered Chicken Penang Curry and it was excellent and very tasty.  Fast food service and great food!

Las Vegas has a lot of Thai restaurants to choose from, many of which are good choices to eat. But what this restaurant has that others lack is fantastic service in addition to high quality food. I'm a stickler on service; I feel that small businesses have great responsibility to provide their guests with the utmost care possible. I'm not sure if the man who took care of us is one of the owners or not, either way he was fantastic- very attentive, willingly answered all of our questions and genuinely seemed to care if we were enjoying ourselves. This location is nowhere near where I live but I know we'll be back in the near future.

We just came from Thailand this week. We were looking for a nice Thai restaurant in the area. We decided to go to this place after reading good reviews from yelp. After visiting the restaurant, we really had a great time here. All food we ordered are so nice. We enjoyed noodle with gravy sauce the most. The owners are also very friendly. We will definitely come back here again. We really recommend this place!
I love this place! Been coming here for the past 4 yrs! Every time I'm craving Thai food, I come here. Plus, everyone that works there is really nice :) I love it!

I haven't eaten here yet but I just read Jennifer J's review and I just needed to comment hahahaha this poor girl is so uneducated with cuisine ingredients that I think we need to all vote her off of yelp lol hilarious! I have learned from some of my closest friends who are from Thailand on how to cook many of my favorite dishes... I know ...lucky right? Anyway SUGAR! is a main ingredient in all Thai food! It's like tomato sauce is to Italian food and salsa to mexican food. I couldn't resist but to say something. Please remove your review miss Jenny J and research before  you leave a comment regarding ingredients.

This place is INCREDIBLE! My boyfriend and I decided to give it a shot blindly.. and the food is so good, the people there are so friendly and make you feel right at home. We have had the garlic peppered chicken, pad woon sen, and the pad Thai with tofu. We originally bought each dish separately to eat and we ended up picking at eachothers food because it's that good!

Had the duck curry and it was pretty damn good, except the carrots were kind of stale-ish idk i took them out, carrots were not good at all. 

So I usually drink water when i go to restaurants and this place by far had the worst water I've ever drank in my life no kidding I should've ordered a Coke.. But I ended up getting a lemonade and they were serving it in like a homemade pitcher it was kind of weird and it wasn't exactly grandmas finest lemonade either.

Food- Great besides the carrots.
Drinks- absolutely horrible 3/10 would bring own.

Staff is very nice though.

The pad Thai smelled so bad my friend couldn't eat her meal. I've had good pad Thai but this place makes there food smell like shit. When my friend could not eat her meal they made her pay for it anyway and asked for a tip. No way. The wasted meal we paid for was their tip. Horrible service and the food smelled rotted. Don't come here if you want to try Thai.

This place is the best in Vegas! I've tried many Thai restaurants here and none compare. I live all the way in North LV but still make a point to get over there at least once a month for curry! The panang and green are so delicious. You can customize heat level on a scale of 1-10 (I usually get a 5 which is still quite spicy). Their golden wings are also super delicious. The staff is always awesome and sweet. You can call in orders and they are ready quick. My whole family loves this place. Never had bad service or bad food and it's still my GO TO for curry!

Found this place by searching reviews.  Decided to try it out. A little hole in the wall.  But really good Thai food. Was fast and full of delicious favors. We consumed it in very little time.  But...no restroom for customers, so go before you get there!
Stellar and amazing! And FAST. This place has spoiled me for all other thai restaurants.
Really good take out food. Have been there several times and only disliked I item and that's was just more my taste. Good quick service and very friendly. Nice find

I am so upset right now. I ordered a flat noodle dish, satay, and Thai tea. Ten minutes before the order was scheduled to be delivered, I received a phone call saying the food was here but I was not answering my door.  I have a doorbell and it never rang. I received the order, opened the containers, and found no peanut sauce. So, I called. I was told the sauce was still in the MICROWAVE and it could be delivered 25-40 minutes later. Trying to be patient, I said I would wait. 45 minutes later I again get a call. No one answered the door (not the same driver) so it was left on my doorstep. Immediately I go to the door. Nothing there. Try to call the number back- no response. Call the restaurant. Was told the sauce was delivered. Explained it wasn't. Second delivery person called me back. She argues with me that she left it on my door step. After arguing back and forth, she goes on to describe the apartment as white (no!) with a red door (no!). I then call the restaurant again and, after listening to ambient noise for ten minutes while the phone sat on a counter, I was told they would remake the stay and deliver it AGAIN. 
What are the odds that no one did something vicious to my food?  
Ugggghhhh.

Lol this is pad Thai??? smells super funky (LIKE FISH SAUCE GROSS) and tastes just like it smells. Not good and over priced af.

I'm sure they paid for their reviews

I've only tried a few dishes for take out, but I loved them all.  Each had it's own distinct Thai flavor, with wonderful spicyness levels.  The Thai Beef Salad had more beef than lettuce!  Which I thought was awesome.  The cucumbers, onions, tomatoes, and cilantro were perfect with the fishy, vinegary, mouth-watering dressing.  The veggie egg rolls were a great starter, not too greasy, with a tasty dipping sauce.  Though the Pad Thai had become one huge clump of noodles by the time I got home, the flavor made me not mind.  I tore that noodle cake up and it was fantastic.  The service is sooo fast and chill, kind and down  to earth.  I recommend it 100%.

We have been twice in the 4 days we have been in Vegas. The food is great, as is the service! 

The first time I got pineapple chicken curry. I got the least amount of heat possible. It was still spicy for me but so good I ate all of it anyway with my tongue on fire! I can't handle heat though... My husband got the roasted duck curry, and loved it- his fav so far.

Tonight I got the cashew chicken, and I loved it! Not hot at all, just full of flavor. My husband got yellow curry with chicken. He got a level 2 hotness on a scale of 1 to 10 both nights. He can handle heat, and he says it was plenty hot.

Loved it! I'm sure we'll be back, and will definitely recommend it!
$6 lunch special with soup, fried rice, green chicken curry and a delicious potsticker.  Absurdly delicious and cheap!

Still one of the best Thai places in town!  Tonight I had to update my review because for the first time I ordered tofu in my dish.  It has been a while since I've had tofu, and normally it isn't  the most flavorful.  This time the tofu was almost like a meat dish!  It was cooked to perfection and complimented my Pad See Ew perfectly!  I just had to reiterate that this place is amazing and every dish I've had has been great!  Now including tofu on my list of dishes I've sampled! Delivery is fast and friendly, and if you go into the restaurant they are friendly and will help you select a dish that is sure to satisfy.

Great food! Great prices! Not in the best location but don't let this stop you from trying this place! Ordered the beef pad Thai, veggie egg rolls, Thai iced tea, and deep fried rice with shrimp. Everything was beautifully prepared and the portions were more than enough for two people. The place was empty when we originally showed up at 1130am, but quickly filled up as we neared 12pm.

Pros:
Piping hot food
Super tasty
Friendly and attentive waitress

Con's:
NADA

TRY THE STCKY RICE WITH MANGO LIKE YOUR LIFE DEPENDS ON IT. :-)

So yeah were do i start ... This is a lil sweet thai spot really quick hit my order before i went ... Defently a good spot if you want to be away from all the crazyness of the strip !!im happy for lil places like this

SOO FRIENDLY AND WOW AMAZING FOOD! Of course I love good deals, but getting great soup, egg roll and meal in less than 7 mins so truly amazing! I actually love the decor, and love how small and 'homey' it is! Even the water was great! I was so happy you could choose from fried and white rice. Their menu is large. I ordered Panang curry chicken and it was exactly what I wanted!! I'll be back often :)

My car keeps coming back here. I can't explain it. I got rid of that car, got another one, came back once more and now the new one keeps coming back. How can this be? 

It's due to service with a smile, good prices, but most important of all it's just good food. I've been stuck on a cashew nut chicken kick for a couple of months now and I know I need to branch out. But if you're having a stress filled day at work sliding into a chair at TFTG and having a glass of Thai Tea and a plate of hot Thai food works wonders at adjusting one's attitude for the remainder of the day. 

4 Stars. The only thing keeping them from 5? They only have 2 bottles of soy sauce and 2 of the little baskets with the peppers and such to share among the tables. But beyond that...it's just good. 

If you've passed this place up due to it's location and end up at one of the most overrated Thai places in America, you're missing out. Make the drive, check it out, remember to ask for some medium to hot heat and enjoy the experience.

There are only 5 tables in this casual restaurant, but we only required one. We shared orders of pad Thai and a special of pumpkin curry with chicken.  The pad Thai was probably the best we have had recently and the pumpkin curry was loaded with flavor.  Prices are very reasonable. .

There are probably about 100 Thai restaurants in the valley but after coming here, I just can't bring myself to frequent anywhere else! First off, this is a "to go" restaurant that happens to have seats. It's very informal and just be aware that although there is no public restroom, there is a sink so you can at least wash your hands before eating. Amazing flavors and great values! One thing that has changed is that most of the noodle dishes have been taken off the lunch special menu so if you love a pad thai like me, you'll have to get a dinner portion even if you're there during lunchtime. Unless you're on a special date or want a formal setting, there is really no reason not to get your thai food from here. Just don't go crazy on the spice level. I usually just get
a 3/10 which is plenty for me!

This is a small "hole in the wall" restaurant that's family-run, with a husband-and-wife team in the kitchen. Having lived in Bangkok for a year of my life, I tend to be a real snob about Thai food. However, I was extremely impressed with Thai Food To Go!

I can only comment on the two dishes I had -- chicken pad see ew and yellow curry chicken -- but both were outstanding. The pad see ew was made exactly the way it is in Bangkok, using Chinese broccoli (essential), and the flavor was outstanding. The standard Thai condiments that are supposed to be served with this dish were on the table just as you'd find in Thailand. The yellow curry was also delicious -- some of the best I've ever had.

I give this place my highest recommendation for its quality of food, authenticity and extremely low prices. The couple who run the place are very friendly and deserve your business. They're serving some of the best Thai food I've had anywhere at borderline fast food prices. Big thumbs up for me!

UPDATE: I ate here again and the food was only above average. The old woman who cooks in the evenings was not there, and whoever was cooking in her place was not quite up to par. If the old lady is there, you're going to have a great experience. If she's not, your mileage may vary.

This place is amazing. Their food is delicious and they give you a lot of portion. For what you pay I think you get more than expected and the food is real authentic Thai. The people that work there are very nice  as well :) have to say my favorite Thai in the Vegas valley.
Looked fresh, tasted fresh. Very flavorful. Didn't skimp on anything. Prompt delivery.

We were looking for good dinner. We purchased stuff along the strip during the day and the price is ridiculously overpriced. My wife was gonna order from another thai restaurant closer to the hotel but for some reason the website wasn't working. This spot was the next up. So glad this was the choice as the price/portion AND taste was great. Highly recommend it.

I wouldn't say it's the best food I've had although I've only had the fried rice with chicken which is amazing. The environment is not very welcoming and they do not have public restrooms. I come to this place occasionally and they are quick with making your food.

I tried pad thai and spicy noodle. Both were very tasty and better than many thai restaurant that I have tried. The restaurant is very small and only has 2-3 small tables (I guess that's why it's called "Thai Food To Go"), but I like the atmosphere. There's no restroom available, only a sink to wash your hands.

Three words. Amazing Green Curry. Period.

Polite and homely owners for the place. Good for veggies too :). Lovely little quaint place serving piping hot amazing Thai food. *on nom nom*
Super sweet mom and pop joint. Food is always great. I recommend their pad see ew, papaya salad Lao style.
Ordered the spicy eggplant with ground chicken. Big veggies and lots of veggies. Greasy but sooo yummy
Me and my family had dinner at Thai food to go. Great food. Good service. I strongly recommend. So full and happy :-)

This place is just a casual dining but their foods are amazing! The place is small, no bathroom, the foods are tasty & very reasonable price. I check in with a free Thai tea is a plus too. They do more on the delivery part I guess.

A dear friend turned me onto this place.I've been looking for good, authentic Thai for some time and this place fills the bill! 
First time out had the green curry with duck. I don't often have duck, but I thought why not try it in curry?? It was fabulous! There was a generous amount of the delicate bird throughout and plenty of veggies too. The portion was easily enough for two meals. I believe I ordered 5 on the heat scale, I don't recall as there was poolside beer drinking involved, but the heat was just right, not overwhelming. If you have it for dinner, add the leftover rice to the remaining curry so it will soak up all the delicious heat!
I did get hooked on the green curry and had it again on my 2nd go, but this time with chicken, same level of heat. Out of this world! 
It's so convenient and we had our orders delivered very fast. I want to go in and sit down for some Pad Thai, and a nice glass of Thai ice tea so I can meet these folks in person to heap praise upon them and their culinary talents!!!

Loved the food. It was honestly the best and closes versions and taste to the actual Thai food. It was prepared and cooked exactly how j remember it. I got the pad Thai which was a great balance of sweet and spicy. The drunken noodles which was very soft and spicy. And the papaya salad, get a hot if you can handle heat, medium wasn't spicy to me and my sister. Defiantly going back again. I've been to sin city Thai restaurant, Naga, and this by far blows them away.
Pad won sen is my jam here! One of my favorite Thai places, I would eat here on my lunch break at least once a week.

Only four small tables for dine in, so if you come during the lunch rush--beware. Ordered fresh spring rolls, pad see ew, and Chinese broccoli with crispy pork between the two of us, and the food was really good. Awesome prices too, so it didn't matter they didn't have lunch specials. Because it's a small mom and pop shop, service can be slow but it's always courteous.

This was another great place thanks to Yelp!!! I was in the area for a doctors appointment and I was craving some Thai food. Yelp saved the day again! 

Talk about hole in the wall place! I absolutely love little unassuming restaurants. Once I walked in I knew it would be tasty. They only have maybe 6 tables, but it just adds to the whole experience. 

Not only is this place unique, but it's very budget friendly! It was just over $20 for two entrees, an appetizer and two sodas. They have a pretty large menu and some really good lunch specials as well. Joel and I both ordered the pad see ew (mine had beef & his had pork)  and we also ordered the veggie egg rolls. The portions were large and it was full of flavor, but I was a bit thrown off having to add the spiciness myself. Most Thai places have a spice scale. They had four little pots with different kinds of peppers and chili sauces. I just started adding ALL the things. We both really enjoyed the flavors and spices we added. The egg rolls were also very tasty and cooked just right. They didn't fall apart when I bit into it. 

I'm always looking for another yummyThai place. Thai To Go fits the bill. Don't let the fact that they are small and a little run down detour you from going. They have very authentic food at great prices. Yelp, thanks again for another awesome find!!

We don't get around to this part of town so this bookmark has been sitting there for a long while. I was dying hungry as I've sat at the hospital all day so I ordered a extra dish for the fiance and I to share. 

Food came out shockingly fast and piping hot off the woks I can hear in the kitchen. 

Pork Larb - it was labeled something along the lines of "spicy special salad (larb) on the menu so I missed it at first, disappointed they didn't make it until I saw a Yelp review that ordered it. I really liked the way they do it here. In general, most places are light on the herbal aspects and I appreciated the abundance of mint, cilantro and thin slices of kefir. I normally add condiments to tweak larb at places to my liking but I didn't touch this at all. Love! 

Green curry with beef - this is a more watery style of curry, but the flavor was definitely there. Lots of carrot, bamboo shoot,bell pepper and basil came along with it so not as much meat, but it's still enough to go around.

Pad kee mao/drunken noodles - the flavors of this was lovely, noodles were perfectly cooked and not gummy and the pork was tender.

The Fiance tends to lean to a milder spice and ordered a 3 which was spicier than average. It seems they employ using the "Thai spicy" scale than the "White Boy Spicy" most use when they see us ordering. Normally a 3 anywhere else is basically having nothing. I can detect some spice here so spice whimps, beware! I like my stuff as spicy as I can tolerate so the condiment wheel is my friend when dining with my guy . If I ain't wincing and breaking a fierce sweat, I am not satisfied. Hurts SO guuuddd.

The girl running the front was very friendly and attentive. The place is pretty small, only 5 tables, probably less than 15 people can dine at once. The prices are cheaper than average (majority of dishes are $7), but probably because they are in a small space in a dead shopping center. On top of the great prices, there is a current check in offer of a free Thai Ice Tea! Just FYI, there is no public restroom. I didn't ask if you can use the kitchen bathroom, but there were no doors leading to a bathroom. There was a sink, however, to wash your hands. 

This is a solid place. The flavors of everything was fresh and seasoned with a knowing hand.  If I'm ever in the area again, I would definitely stop but this seems to be one of those hole in the walls worth actually coming this way for.
Food is amazing. I love to explore and eat thai food and i must say i think that they have the best pad thai ever compared to all the thai restos i have eaten!!!! Try their pad thai!!!!!

Second time ordering pick up here. They have great tasting food, nice portions, and quick service. I mean what else could you want? I had the Pad Thai combo which is of course a stable at any Thai place, and it was delicious. I've also had the chow mein which was wonderful as well. If you're looking for a quick and yummy spot to eat order from these guys!

Excellent thai restaurant. I really love how every dish has a authentic taste!

Things we've ordered:

1.Tum Yum soup with chicken (SPICE #7) 
2.Chicken Satay with their special peanut sauce!!!
3.Pad Kee Mao (SPICE #7)
4.Chicken Pad Thai
5. Fried bread
6. Beef jerky
7.Unlimited Thai Tea (BEST THAI TEA EVER) not too sweet... Just RIGHT! 
 
Service 100% on task.

I ordered 3 entrees delivery, with a free order of spring rolls for being $30+. The order came neatly wrapped with the rice in take-out boxes and curry separated. 
 
Crispy Pork Chinese Broccoli - The pork was very well seasoned and flaky and the vegetable mix is a nice variety. A great pick for someone who likes spicy but rather plain food.  
Roasted Duck Curry - Curry came packed separately from the rice so no soggy rice. Sweet and buttery with several slices of duck.  
Spicy Catfish - A little disappointed with this one as the catfish was so fried as to be chewy and the pepper was overpowering.
Pick-up & Delivery...First time excellent! Second time very greasy & just OK. Maybe a different cook? Will try again.
Ordered thee red and panang curry both are yummers^^ good customer service. First time here and I will come back.
Got a delivery food was good but the container that the soup came from had a hole in  and it spilled all over my work desk how unprofessional
Once you come here you will never go to another Thai restaurant again.  Put simply,  food and value cannot be beat!

Now this place has the easiest menu to order from. its not so complicated like most thai restaurants. but i can actualy say that i really like everything that ive tried here. So just because of the location do not pass this place up. ANY NOODLE DISH IS AWESOME. and the basil chicken is the business. (pad ka prow chicken with rice and a fried egg on top)oh dont forget a thai tea. YUMMY ..see you soon thai food to go
This place doesn't know what bland is. Dishes are bursting w flavor and presentation is something they know makes a difference! Curry fried rice and crispy pork w broccoli was superb.

The food was decent..I gave 4stars because of the service..very nice people...we ordered the fried chicken over rice and garlic chicken which were both pretty good!..we also ordered crab ragoons which were cold inside..

My wife and I have eaten from here many times in the past few months and they have never failed to produce great food!

I am in love with the bbq pork fried rice, and my wife can't get enough of their beef Larb.

Great flavors, reasonable price, and good service!

Did not disappoint. My boss and I ordered from work and they got to our office fast.
The food was on point. Pad Thai chicken, fresh rolls, yellow curry and Larb were all good. I definitely recommend.

Ok if you look at how many times I have been here guess I need to update. The family in this place is Sooooo cool! We aren't afraid to ask for something to be changed, maybe a little more ginger or a little less bamboo. Whatever it is they are gracious and helpful. Their menu is diverse and tasty. I have been making myself step out of my habits and try different things. 
Its a small space but they can seat groups with some imagination ;) I cant think of any place I like to go quite so much. 
Thanks guys, you rock!
Very good food. Good service and very friendly people. I never had Thai food and this place was very yummy.

Food is amazing! Great service & the food gets on your table within 5 minutes of your order (: love it!!

Xo

We have been exploring local restaurants lately and we tried Thai Food To Go today for lunch.  We were looking for a good neighborhood Thai place with a lunch special for under $6.00 (their's is $5.50) and we were impressed!  We live closer to Komol but I don't think they have lunch specials. The place was really clean and the owner was really nice and attentive.  Since the place was so small we decided to go after any lunch rush and we had a very enjoyable meal.  I had the red curry which I have recently discovered is almost my most favorite Thai curry, and my husband had the chicken with cashews.  The soup that comes with the meal was very fresh tasting with carrots, cabbage and tofu, so we are looking forward to trying the Tom Yum and/or Tom Kha the next time.  And even more exciting is we live close enough for delivery in the very near future.  Or we can always stop by after we hit Barefoot Bob's....

This is a very good Thai restaurant. They could improve on their ventalation, though. The food has quite an authentic taste and is not loaded with sugar like most Thai restaurants that serves westerners.  I'm very picky when it comes to Thai restaurants since I'm Thai and I know how each dish should taste.  Try their One Sun Beef jerky with sticky rice (Nua Dad Deow). The sauce that comes with it is great! We'll definitely be back.

I ordered from TFTG using eat 24 for the first time last week and I thought it was ok despite the fact that I found a long hair in my spring roll. Then they went to overcharge me for no reason and when I called to ask about it a rude man says call eat 24 and hung up. Eat 24 fixes it so tonight giving them the benefit I decided to try them again but after I placed my order eat 24 calls and says they cancelled my order because they don't have drivers. I call TFTG and ask them about placing an order the man says call eat 24 and hung up. I call eat 24 back and they say that I was banned from making orders with them. So I call TFTG AGAIN and try to get to the bottom of this. The same rude guy who told me to call eat 24 says we don't deliver to you anymore and hangs up. Unsanitary, rude, and unprofessional.

I hadn't been to this place before. Was a little nervous to try a new Thai place, because not all Thai is created equal. I had the drunken noodles and they were really tasty. Portions are very large, price was super reasonable $8 for my lunch plate. Wasn't my absolute favorite Thai place but I would definitely go back.

Why did I not come here sooner?! Thanks to fellow yelpers for steering me in the right direction! Finally decided to try Thai Food To Go due to the awesome reviews and boy am I glad I did.

First and foremost, when you check in with your Yelp app, you get a FREE thai tea. So just show the waitress! The thai tea wasn't too sweet, which was great. I hate drinking di

For the $5.95 lunch special, you get your choice of dish and meat with steamed white rice or fried rice (which wasn't really fried rice, more like mixed rice), soup, and one pot sticker or spring roll. I opted for their green curry with chicken and fried rice and pot sticker. They have a spicy scale of 1-10 and the lady who took my order suggested 5 since she said it was pretty spicy. But I LIKE SPICY SO I WAS LIKE, LEVEL 7 PLEASE. You thought I was going to say 10 huh? HAHA! 

My friend got their pad see ew since that's usually my favorite dish so this way, we could share. 

The food came out FAST. Which was awesome because both of us were starving. The surprisingly, the portions are pretty huge. I was surprised how much curry they gave you for the lunch special. 

The curry was yummy. It was spicy but not TOO spicy. But then again, I can take the spice. It was so good. I just couldn't stop eating. Though, next time, I think I would much rather prefer steamed white rice over the fried rice. And I will get a 10 next time (: 

The pad see ew was equally yummy. It was delicious! It had the perfect flavor and aroma to it. They stir fried it really well too. 

Overall, amazing food for the price! I definitely want to come back. In fact, I MISS IT. I MISS IT SO MUCH I wanna go back ASAP. Haha but first, need to find time.

So give it a try :D AMAZING FOOOODS!

Im updating this because they had a Re Grand Opening. And the seating area is still quaint. They added a flat screen tv. I had this dish, i cant remember the name. But it was with crispy ramen noodles in a gravy that got soft as you ate it topped with chicken with pepper and broccoli and snap beans. DELICIOUS. My friend had Pineapple fried rice with chicken and shirmp and raisins and cashews. He was kind of pessimistic about trying it, but convinced him it was delicious. 
He ended up taking some home. NOM NOM NOM. The Quality is still there, and the prices are still cheap. They gave free refills on his thai tea as well. Most places i know dont give free refills on thai tea. Not sure if they always do it though. SInce they are open go back in you wont regret it.

Every time I come home to Vegas I have to have food from Thai Food to Go!! I feel deprived if I can't have their incredible Fried Chicken. All my friends love their spicy food too!! (I am a wimp) but you have to try their Pot Stickers, they are air Fried crispy and so delicious you have to try them!!

Pretty good ,.liked everything I ordered, the prices are cheap too, 
Green chicken curry
Papaya salad
Seafood Tom yum
Chicken satay

Yelp 100 Challenge 29

We were looking for Thai food and came across this little place in a strip mall. Noticed several people picking up take out orders while we were there.  It's a casual little place, a few tables and very nice, friendly employees.

I ordered the pad see ew and thank goodness I remembered to ask if it contained msg.  Fortunately, the gentleman helping us said it did and when I explained my sensitivity, he assured me it could be omitted. My hubby ordered the pad Thai noodles with tofu, also, no msg requested. Both dishes were good, just a bit oily for my taste.

Both dishes were attractively presented. Portion size was just right. I do wish it had been cooked with a tad less oil. The tofu was also fried, a lesson for me to remember to ask for it to be steamed next time.

If you're in a hurry and looking for a solid Thai meal, this is your place. If fine dining is what you're after, this is not for you.

I was here for their lunch special. I have been to Thailand multiple times growing up and love Thai food. I didn't expect much of this place given the setting and the price. But I was pleasantly surprised. It's tasty, pretty authentic, and with good Thai flavors. The food is on the spicy side so go lower on the spicy numbers and you can always add more.

I live just between Stick E Rice and Thai Food to Go, but only just discovered Thai Food to Go.  In the past two weeks I've been 4 times and I love it.  Kunchorn had been my to go Thai place and I was so saddened when they never reopened in June.  But now I have a new favorite.
Thai Food to Go is a small restaurant with just 5 tables, a dive?.  But it is clean, the staff are all very friendly, and I find the food to be superior to most of the other local Thai restaurants.
Pros: 
Flavorful and nuanced food
Good prices and large portions
Fast service - at lunch it slows down just because of the sheer number of orders coming out of the kitchen
Lunch specials are a great deal!

Cons:
Limited menu
Inconsistent with heat levels 

My husband prefers Stick E Rice likely for the ambience.  He says the menu is larger but he always gets the same thing so I'm sure that isn't the reason.  

They no longer offer the free Thai Iced Tea or appetizers with your order.  But if you check in with Yelp they are currently offering a free Thai Iced Tea with $15 or more order.

Anyway, if you are looking for authentic food, served in a relaxing and comfortable atmosphere, without breaking the bank, I recommend trying Thai Food to Go.

Try the Pad Woon Sen, Green and Panang curries!

The service was ok. They brought us the wrong fried rice at first but was quickly taken back to the kitchen and got us the right one we ordered. The beef salad tasted fresh and refreshing. The crab fried rice and pork spicy basil are good as any thai food in town if not better. My daughter also loved their BBQ chicken over fried rice. The only downside was that I had To carry my 18 month old son since they didn't have a high chair available. Also they don't have a bathroom for customers (I was a bit taken back by that).  But at least the food was good.

Went there for a lunch special which is only like $5.50.
It comes with soup and a choice of veg roll or chicken something not sure what it was.
I dont like sweet taste and hence requested for no sugar in my food. Yes people sugar is used in many American restaurants so much that no one even notices it.
Best Thai food in Vegas. Great food made the way you like it without breaking the bank. 
Either ways, for the price its great food and the owners are great.

I ordered the salmon pangang  curry and fresh shrimp spring rolls. They delivered deep fried spring rolls, I caught the driver before he left and gave him the spring rolls and took my money back to pay when he returned. Well after deqlung with the owner whom I couldn't deal with because all he wanted to do was argue about what I ordered.
