I ended up just paying for the salmon pangang and no I didn't pay their outrageous delivery charge of $5. I wish I would have jus gave him all the food back and kept all my money because after 2 bites I threw the food away. It was dry and the veggies were hard and the dish in general had no flavor. I don't think it was even salmon, it had a dry fish texture but didn't taste like it at all. Lunch FAIL for sure.
Very friendly, polite, excellent take-out Thai food. We had the pumpkin curry with pork and the drunken noodles with beef,  both were excellent!

Love ordering deliver here,  a little bit pricy but you get what you pay for definitely! They're literally 3 min away from my house and the delivery time is great. Love them! The food is so good and different.

Well it looks like we are on a Thai food kick, so here we go.

After eating at Stick E Rice a couple of days ago and loving the food there, we decided to give another highly rated place a try.

For comparisons we ordered the same dishes.

Chicken Satay
Chicken Pad Thai
Crispy pork with broccoli

If we had eaten here first we would of been very happy, however, having eaten at Sticky E Rice first, how to put this without meaning we we not impressed, I guess the easy way of saying it is, it's like comparing restaurant food with street food, both are good in their own separate ways, but the food at Thai to Go is certainly simpler.

The food at Stick E Rice had more complex tastes to them, again nothing against Thai Food to Go, food is highly subjective at the best of times and either of these two places would make for a great meal.

Pound for pound one of the better Thai food places in Las Vegas. This restaurant is located in a strip mall shopping center. The dining room is fairly small with just 4 tables. It seems that most of their business comes from take out orders. The food is great ; I've had several dishes here and each has been flavorful and filling. The prices make this place a for sure 5 Star spot. Can't beat the food quality / price.  Came here for lunch once and was in and out within an hour.
Awesome spot for Thai in Vegas. Got a free tea with my Yelp check in. Definitely coming back when I am in town.

Awesome sauce PERIOD! OMG i love hole in the wall thai spots. The food was spectacular, and service was good too. 10 stars all around on everything. You have to get the Thai tea. The mango sticky rice was a bit salty but the sweet & sour soup made up for it YUM! go go go now! Your life will never be the same. When it comes to thai food anyway.
This place has great food and friendly service. Their $5.50 lunch special is awesome. My coworkers and I usually order yellow curry and we love that they will deliver.

The service is always very welcoming here. They updated the restaurant a lot. New tables and chairs, even the wall has something new to it. Also I believe they just added online ordering. 

I ordered vegetable rolls and garlic chicken. $17.23 + tips. Always very delicious. Seriously all very good tasting. For the 2 years I've been frequenting this place they still have an A from the health dept.

This little hole in the wall Thai restaurant is a real diamond in the rough.  I ate lunch with a friend here a couple of years ago and I've gone back quite a few times to pick up food to go! I usually order the same things but the taste never falters so of course I keep coming back!  It has really small eat in area so I don't know that I'd stay to eat, again but I definitely will continue grabbing "to go"!

They delivered to me even though the hotel I was staying at was greater than their delivery radius.  Delivery was quick and the food was tasty. I ordered the duck curry and pad see ew.  Good sized portion for the price.  Next time I'm in Vegas and I am too lazy to leave my hotel, I will definitely order from them again!

The food was made super fast! My bf loved the pot stickers and I'm obsessed with the fresh spring rolls. They are the best I've had in town:) the chicken pad Thai was tasty and we also have tried the sticky mango rice this is our new go to for Thai
Best Thai BBQ chicken, Pad Thai and pineapple fried rice. There's no public bathroom, but the price and quality outweigh that. Highly recommended.
Food was OK. I ordered it spicy and Ive had mild salsas with more heat. It had a good flavor just not what I was looking for at the time. I might give them a second try.

I am only giving this a 4 because my mom bought the jerky for me so I didn't get the chance to view the whole selection. 

I had the Thai Style jerky. Excellent!! You get a great combo of flavors with sweet, spicy, lime, and lemon-grass. They jerky was tender and flavor full. 

My next selection was a lo-carb teriyaki. It also had great flavor and is made with splenda. 

Over all very good hand made beef jerky with nice flavors. Definitely try the Thai Style. I also believe this place is in the indoor swap meet.

Being so cheap I thought it was going to be average but I know Asian food and it was really good. The main lady didn't really speak English but she was so sweet. Big servings.....very very fast. They deliver within 3 miles for orders over $15.
Will absolutely eat there again or get delivery!

I hope they never close. I've ordered from them delivery, take out, and eat in. Here's what is good.
1. Panang any style.
2. Seafood Tom Yum especially if I am not feeling well. 
3. Potstickers. Nobody makes them like this. Nobody anywhere- you'll just have to try them. 
4. Drunken noodles any style.
5. Catfish! I'm not kidding. It is often a special and it is creative- just very good. 
6 Thai beef salad.
This is a really good local restaurant. Run by really nice people. I go to more expensive 'hangs' with my friends and the food is not as good. Anytime I've had friends over and I've ordered some in everybody really loves it. 
Oh and the price is decent! 
I hope this place takes off. Very nice family making amazing food. My favorite place.

I had their Pad Thai noodles with chicken and a side of their vegetable rolls. The rolls were outstanding but I'm not a fan of their Pad Thai.

I've eaten Pad Thai coast-to-coast and their flavor just didn't cut it.

I was gonna tell a Thai joke....but Phuket.  

This restaurant is located on Desert Inn between Pecos & McLeod.  Went on Wednesday 3-30-16 at 6pm for some takeout.  $9.15 got me an order of Pad See Ew and an order of sticky rice. 

The restaurant is in an older and very small strip mall and only has about 5 tables.  I don't think there is a public restroom on site.   The place is of questionable cleanliness...especially if you peek back into the kitchen area.  I would be much happier if I had not seen the inside and had just ordered delivery.  

I always get the same thing from here...the $7.95 pad see ew with chicken and then I substitute regular broccoli for the chinese broccoli.  Last night's version was probably the most disappointing...the chicken tasted like it was cooked days ago and one out of every 5 bites or so was SPICY. 

It was like playing spicy noodle roulette....will this bite be normal or set my mouth on fire? Only one way to find out....OM NOM NOM.  

When they have it (which is almost never), their mango sticky rice is amazing.  They haven't had it the last 3 times I've gotten food from there.  They keep telling me it's not in season.  The sticky rice has the most amazing texture...unlike anything I've ever had before.  It's so chewy and fragrant.  

So...the food is normally very tasty.  They are cheap.  They deliver.  I can't ask for more.

Absolutely one of my favorite Thai places to go to. Their portions are rather larger compared to most other Thai restaurants, and not to mention their phenomenal prices and lunch specials. The Pad See Yew here is one of my favorites, as is the Chicken chili mint. Don't judge this place by appearances, it's definitely a hole in the wall looking place but a gem for sure.

Great Thai food here. Be careful on the spice level they can get hot. But if you enjoy spicy food like I do then that is not a bad thing. Their Thai dishes and soups are very good but as the name implies ordering take out is ideal as they do not have much room to sit and no customer bathrooms. That is the only reason I would take a star off as the food is very good as are the prices.

Life is about managing expectations.  This Thai dive provoked an expectation by it's namesake that their respective target market is the "TO GO" crowd.  Ok, got it.

Ok, just to prove my point and to be a smart ass, I googled "the definition of TO GO"...it crashed Google...so, when I read "TO GO" I assumed it to mean...hey, let's get some fast food and keep moving....

I only have 30 minutes for lunch and I work on the east side of the Valley which just seems notoriously slow whatever direction you are going.  I had forgotten my lunch today and instead of heading to the conveniently located but boring local Subway, I opted to YELP something new.  This eatery is approximately 2.5 miles from my work so I figured I was safe if it was fast.

First an accident on Eastern.  That took an extra 10 minutes.  Then, my friggin Yelp app refused to talk to my Android Google maps Navigator....kept sending me to Latitude where I kept seeing my g/f's last location 2 days ago (WTF Latitude...anyone awake over there at Google?).  So, driving blind but I find the restaurant ok.

Since I had arrived at a "TO-GO" place, I assumed they would be waiting on me...So, I quickly picked up a menu...but, thinking in the spirit of expediency, let me just order some PAD THAI and Wonton Soup.  The lady seems Thai so I hedge my bets and make sure she does not get confused with my Alaskan accent and just order  #10 and #21 off their menu.  She gets very confused.  So, I then say, "Pad Thai and Won Ton soup please..."  Still does not register with her....So, I break out the menu and quick point to my two items.  She gets the Pad Thai written down and then looks at me blankly...Yes, I would like some Wonton soup also...

After 20 minutes, this has given me an opportunity to scrutinize the less than tidy tiny place and wondered how bright their business future is if they just opened.  As with most Thai peoples and restaurants, they are very polite and friendly but already my expectations have been disappointed.  They did bring me a Thai ice tea while I waited without asking.  I do not like Thai ice tea.  

So, now I am stressed because I am late and I actually have two time-sensitive projects at work.  This 20 minute adventure took close to 50 minutes. :(

Once I got back into my cubicle, I opened my food...huge portions and not really typical of a lunch menu.  I had hoped the lunch menu would have a cup of wonton soup not like the 23 gallon size.  Never touched the soup and maybe I will have for dinner.  The pad thai was very good but the 'foreplay' to my meal took away from the potential pleasure of enjoying a thai lunch.

In conclusion, I would not recommend this place.
Nice place... Good service... Close to vegas... Ordered tom kha , green curry, drunken noodles... Nice food

A Thai restaurant that epitomizes and reinforces the positive connotation we associate with "hole in the wall" 

My partner in crime & I stopped in for last a last minute lunch sesh. The place is quaint, roughly 4-5 tables (hence the place is not called Thai Food To Dine-in). We sat down, browsed through the lunch menu and made out selections. 

First and foremost, the lunch menu is very reasonable. $5.50 gets you an entr√©e, fried/steamed rice, and hot & sour soup. I ordered the green chicken curry, she ordered the stir fry veggie platter. Both dishes had excellent flavor. The cute solo pot sticker that accompanies the dish is tasty, too. The thing that pushed this place from 4 to 5 stars was the presentation. One would expect this to be lackluster with the cheap prices, yet they managed to present me with a dish that was Instagram worthy (Lo-fi with the green curry makes for a good pic). My partner in crime is on a no meat-save-the-world kick, so it was nice to see that they are able to alter dishes in order to accommodate vegetarians. 

They have bottled water & cans of soda for a buck & of course they have Thai tea. The tea was great. We noticed they serve dessert as well. I remember seeing fried banana ice cream, but was stuffed so I made no further inquires. 

Service was great. Food came out quick.

All in all, everything you would want for a quick, affordable, and tasty lunch experience. I look forward to visiting again soon. Support local businesses.
Absolutely delicious Thai food. Got the Pad see ew, drunken noodle, cashew chicken, green curry, and egg rolls. Nice sized portions, good prices, and they delivery quickly! Highly recommend.

I ordered pickup through Eat24, & the food was prepared in a very timely matter. I got the roasted duck with red curry. It was very delicious. I was very pleased with the chunks of pineapple and tomato in it, and they even included a box of rice for me, which I usually have to pay extra for at other places.

Don't order pad Thai here. Everything else was ok but the pad thai smelled like shit. Egg rolls and fried rice were ok. Steamed rice wasn't to great either. Serviced sucked they didn't give me a receipt and kept my change..
With the help of yelp of course I landed at this hidden gem. We ordered crab fried rice and drunken noodles. Both were intoxicatingly good. I'll definitely come back when I visit LV!

Thai comfort food that's reliably good. I've been ordering delivery and have never been inside (a good thing baaed on some reviews of questionable cleanlinesss that I'd have to ignore; the food I'd worth it). The noodle and rice dishes are flavorful and have heaps of veggies compared to other Thai places nearby. I recommend the Thai beef jerky and drunken fried rice. 
I wouldn't recommend the Tom Kha soup, it really is just coconut broth with little to no flavor :(
Awesome food.   Excellent cook.  Veggies cooked just right.  Large portions.   Best thai in the area so far we've tried.  No restroom, hence 4 stars.

Did my first UberEats. 1) amazed at the process 2) amazed that for less than $20 I could have take out driven to me and 3) amazed how much food I got and it was actually GREAT. 
Ordered chicken satay and parang pork and delivered for $18 to Renaissance. Incredible.

I have used yelp quite a bit. It has been very helpful to find good food spots. I have not ever taken the time to write a review before. But this was my third time getting togo form here. The first two times were great. Portion size was very generous and the price was great. But after a long and rough day I decided to order again. When I got home I found that the portion size was almost half what it usually is. I called but the staff didn't really seem to care.

If I hadn't had such a rotten day maybe it wouldn't have been such a big deal but I don't think I will be returning. I really feel their customer service and care is lacking.

We discovered this place on Yelp, and had a very nice experience there. The exteriors are ordinary, and even from inside, it felt like a small, family-run restaurant. I must say that the food was very good and the host was fairly warm. We had ordered Pad thai noodles, Drunken fried rice and Penang veg curry. A word of caution - even at spice level of 5/10, we found the food very spicy even to our Indian tastebuds! We still liked the food and finished all of it :) We had found an offer for free thai ice tea on Yelp check-in. Generally I have seen merchants limit such offers to only one per table, but she herself asked for number of check-ins, and gave us 3 tea. By the time we finished the food, we were pretty full, but the bill was still under 6$ per person. Overall a very nice discovery, definitely going back there next time we visit Vegas.

My husband was craving Thai food so I found this place on Yelp and had to give it a try for dinner. It's more like 3.5 stars...

SERVICE: 5 stars
The  gentleman who waited on us was attentive and super friendly

FOOD: 3 stars
Vegetarian egg rolls - had too much vermicelli noodles and not enough veggies...bland
Chicken Panang Curry- very authentic tasting but it seemed too watery and itneeded to be thicker
Pad Kee Mao - good amount of veggies and very flavorful (I liked this dish the best)
Spiced green beans with chicken - initially, they messed up the order.  I told them absolutely no spice because the kids were going to eat it.  Maybe a misunderstanding?  Anyways, they were really nice and remade the dish without any spices and it still tasted wonderful.

It's located in a strip mall and lots of free parking.  I

Very happy with what I got here! As others have mentioned take it very easy when order spicy food as they like to throw bunch of it in. Had taken that into consideration and still was a touch hot. 

Ordered the chicken pad Thai and was very pleased. Had good amount of spice and tasted very nice. 

The ambiance, for a Thai restaurant, was actually quite nice. The seating area was a little small, maybe 7-10 two person tables. The waiter was quite good, and gave couple tips. 

The price was quite good also. Have paid more and been dissatisfied quite often, but not with this place!

My tummy and my wallet just did a happy dance together!

For $5.50, I got a lunch and it was fantastic. I ordered the yellow curry with steamed rice. They offer fried or brown as well. For that price, you also get a wonton or an eggroll. I went with the eggroll, although it was nothing to write home about. If you dine in there is a free Thai iced tea with check-in. This is a must. 

You'd think the best part about this meal would be the price, but no, the food is actually really tasty as well. The flavors were well-developed and they weren't overly sweet or spicy. I ordered a spice level 6 to err on the side of caution and it had a nice kick. I'll definitely amp up the spice level on my next visit. I'm looking forward to trying their other lunch specials as well. Looking over the rest of the menu their prices are pretty good overall. They have a specials board and every one of them sounded delicious. 

The restaurant is tiny. Only about four or five tables of two, so be advised. They also deliver within a three-mile radius. Unfortunately for me, I'm well outside of that. Great little lunch spot in a very unassuming mini mall.
The place needs some major renovation or a major cleaning. A little scary in there. Food ok.
Excellent little place! We didnt want to eat on the Strip so we decided to travel a bit further out. Totally worth the ride. Great food! Loved the duck red curry, tres amigos and eggplant dish.

I love Thai food and this place is excellent.  Not only was the food terrific but the prices even better.  Service was also great.  You don't go here for the atmosphere or to impress a date but if you just want great Thai Food at a great price I don't think you can beat it in Vegas.

The lady was super nice. I had the Thai tea, pad see ew with chicken, and mango with sticky rice. Food was legit and came out super fast. I'll definitely come back.
